programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Contestants from Bournemouth, Dorset, compete to host the best dinner party and win £1,000 cash prize. Sue and Shaun kick things off with a Mediterranean-inspired menu. Next, competitive newlyweds Sam and Emma show off their love of surfing with a laid-back evening, and John and Livi take charge for the final party when it's all about looking good.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Dan Hatfield and his team try to do a deal on a tank, and one customer wants £10,000 for his gold. Meanwhile, Nathan Finch is bewitched by some valuable paintings.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Pickwick Pawnbrokers boss Nathan and manageress Debbs take a spin in a mini-hovercraft, and at Nikolas Patrick in Kent, Charlie turns his attention to skateboarding merchandise.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: In Liverpool, Kirstie Allsopp catches up with student Kate Harland, who was desperate to swap her noisy flat for something more grown up. She also revisits Kelly Price and Emma Wilcox on the Berkshire and Hampshire borders, whose house-hunting had been the cause of a few tears.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps house hunters in West Yorkshire and Sussex to find a home that provides them with both the peace and quiet of a rural idyll and convenient access to the city.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Tushielaw Inn in Selkirk, owned by Rab and Gail Forbes, who opened their historic inn just six months previously.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Five people from Swindon take turns trying to throw the perfect dinner party. International DJ Mark Eteson hosts the first night and hopes his Ibiza-style menu featuring Bora Bora Beach brownies, paella and fishcakes will be a hit, before challenging his guests to a rave-off which he will judge himself.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Amateur dramatics enthusiast Michaela Kearns hosts the second party in Swindon, but admits she is not much of a cook. She hopes to dazzle her guests with a glamour-filled evening featuring melted chocolate with dipping treats, but anticipates she might not be able to persuade her fellow diners to take part in her planned show tune performance - complete with a full band.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Financial advisor Scott Hillier hosts Swindon's third party, hoping to impress his guests with a Wild West-themed evening. Tensions run high as Gill Bright awkwardly apologises to last night's host Michaela Kearns and Scott Hillier hopes to smooth things over by performing a rap.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Direct sales manager Sally Rachael hosts the fourth dinner party in Swindon, featuring a `girls' night in' theme with mysteriously titled dishes and a quirky dress code that leaves her guests clueless and unhappy.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Alternative therapist Gill Bright hosts the final dinner party in Swindon and has plans for an `upstairs downstairs' Edwardian-themed evening with sophisticated food followed by some circle dancing to Bob Marley.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay heads to the Park's Edge restaurant in Atlanta, Georgia, where a series of spats with the local community are hampering its success. Owners Richard and Jorge's in-fighting has alienated locals, and the duo's suggestion that customer numbers are low because of racism has heightened tensions.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Anthony Wedo, President and CEO of Buffets, Inc, goes undercover to find out what his staff members are really like. He was brought on to the team to turn the firm around after years of challenges and poses as a construction worker to find out the flaws in the business.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: The mystery of red rain falling in Sri Lanka and India, how unusual weather is making Florida the sinkhole capital of the world, and strange lights in the sky that are baffling locals in a remote Norwegian town. Plus, ready-made snowballs in Alaska, giant spiderwebs covering trees in Pakistan, shard of ice sprouting from the ground in someone's back garden, and an underwater cloud in Mexico.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Michel Roux Jr, Fred Sirieix, Jay Rayner, Stacie Stewart and Lucy Alexander taste-test four brands of Cheddar; chocolate sponge pudding and a ready meal chicken tikka masala. Plus, the public blind tasting session features four popular brands of cider.(n)

programme.title: Supershoppers
programme.desc: Anna Richardson and Andi Osho reveal how switching supermarket aisles can save customers money on their shopping. Plus, reports on whether vitamin drinks are worth the extra cash, kids' toothpastes that don't meet national guidelines, and controversial over-50s insurance policies.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Officers prepare to interview a care worker who has been brought in for questioning despite her adamant denial of the theft of a gold bracelet from someone she was looking after. Another man in custody denies being involved in a stabbing at a corner shop, while a suspect who has been wanted for six months has finally handed himself to police to be questioned over a violent assault outside a nightclub.(n)

programme.title: Life Behind Bars: Visiting Hour
programme.desc: Cameras focus on the visiting room at HMP Low Moss, one of Scotland's largest maximum security prisons. It offers an insight into the people doing hard time as they meet loved ones. Featured contributors include Gary and Charley who plan their wedding, even though he doesn't have a release date. Meanwhile, fellow inmate Mike receives a visit from his ageing father.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in at the 90-year-old Monticello Hotel in Longview, Washington, where owner Phillip Lovingfoss has an apparent liking for alcohol that some of his staff claim is threatening to destroy the business. The challenge of turning around the hotel's fortunes only increases when the chef sees shocking allegations about Phillip splashed all over the front page of the local newspaper.(n)

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade guides another team of five well-known faces on an epic adventure through four fantastical zones - Aztec, Medieval, Industrial and Futuristic. In each zone the team must tackle physical, skill, mystery and mental challenges in a bid to win crystals. These elusive crystals each give them five seconds inside the iconic Crystal Dome, where they hope to collect gold tokens to convert into prizes. This instalment sees adventurers Steve Jones, Scarlett Moffatt, David Coulthard, Joey Essex and team captain Jodie Kidd hope to conquer the maze, in support of the charity Stand Up to Cancer.(n)

programme.title: Bodyshockers
programme.desc: Katie Piper meets more people who love or loathe their body modifications, including Malcolm, who is getting a skull design scarred into his skin, and a mum with a crumbling nose job who is going under the knife again to get it fixed. Sisters Karyse and Deanna plan joint nose jobs on the same day, while Georgia wants to get rid of a tattoo she got after a night out. The programme also features a woman who regrets getting her breasts enlarged from an A to a G cup, and a man with body work ambitions that are out of this world.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An 18-year-old is rushed in after breaking his leg while playing football, and doctors worry it may have long-term implications. Meanwhile, David, who is 29, is airlifted to St George's following a head-on collision at speed, and 94-year-old Mary arrives after falling backwards down 14 steps and losing consciousness.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, as Jon Richardson and David O'Doherty take on guest captain Johnny Vegas and Jamie Laing. Holly Walsh joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: The Windsors
programme.desc: New series. The satirical comedy soap opera about the royal family returns. Prince Charles refuses to help Theresa May secure a trade deal with the Chinese, but when Camilla withholds his conjugal rights, Charles agrees to host a banquet. Wills wants to be a hands-on dad, mixing with ordinary parents, but comes to realise childcare is a nightmare, while Pippa is preparing to marry Johnny, but is enraged that Kate has been made patron of Wimbledon and decides to put a gypsy curse on her.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef tries to transform the fortunes of Sebastian's, a pizzeria in Burbank, Los Angeles, which is failing to attract customers, leaving the owner in debt and struggling to support his family. Gordon is horrified to discover pre-processed and frozen ingredients on the menu, but there seems to be little he can do to help when he is thrown out of the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Newcastle, three rival couples battle it out to host the best dinner party. Partners Fiona and Hannah kick things off with their Moroccan-themed menu. Couple David and Sonia, and childhood sweethearts Claire and Steven, all agree the puppet show was unexpected. Day two sees Steven and Claire's German-inspired menu. Finally, David decides a charm offensive is needed for his and Sonia's night.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Nikolas Patrick pawnbrokers in Kent, brothers Charlie and Patrick receive an Olympic torch that the owner wants £10,000 for, as well as some designer bags and a collection of antique firearms. Love is in the air for a newly engaged couple in Sheffield, and some rare footwear comes in.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, pawnbroker Dan at London Road is faced with a collection of crystals that owners Lynette and David want big money for. At Nikolas Patrick in Kent, brothers Charlie and Patrick run aground while testing a speedboat, and Sophie wants instant cash for her diamante-covered Jimmy Choo shoes.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with Mel and Jon, who had their hearts set on owning a piece of the Herefordshire countryside, while Kirstie Allsopp revisits outdoor sports enthusiasts Liz and John, a year after helping them find a property to suit their needs in Derby.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps two sets of house hunters, including Maddie and Nick in Hampshire, who are looking to find a home that feels rural while offering a bit of cafe culture.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: As the B&B owners meet for the final time, Paul Martin and Jayne Kirk from The Forest Country House want to get to the bottom of Nadia's low scores.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Personal trainer Eve Booth hosts the first dinner party in Co Durham and Wearside, expressing concern that her starter of haggis and black pudding may not be to everyone's taste. Although her main course gets a lukewarm reception, the biggest threat to the evening seems to be fellow contestant Ken Brown's taste in jokes.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Interior designer and gypsy wedding supplier Paula Thompson hosts the second party in Co Durham and Wearside, and hopes to bring a touch of class to the proceedings with her `black and bling' themed event. The evening's menu includes fresh lobster and hairy prawns, accompanied by a spot of belly dancing.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nineteen-year-old languages student Donal Anand-Shaw hosts the third dinner party in Co Durham and Wearside, and decides to make the event black tie. He also arranges for a string quartet to play, and serves up a locally-sourced scallop starter.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Debt collector Eleri Watson hosts the fourth dinner party in Co Durham and Wearside. However, her efforts to organise an all-Welsh evening do not go according to plan when soil is found in the leek soup and lamb is served burned, dampening the guests' enthusiasm.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Businessman Ken Brown hosts the final dinner party in Co Durham and Wearside, and hopes to entertain his guests with a `wear a wig' themed evening. After annoying his fellow contestants over the past week, he hopes to make amends with his unique entertainment, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Amit Kleinberger, the CEO and co-owner of frozen yoghurt chain Menchie's, poses as a participant in a reality TV contest to find out whether consistency is being maintained in his stores. The company has experienced rapid growth and Amit tries to establish what changes must be made to become a billion-dollar business.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet two couples looking for homes in the countryside of either Kent or neighbouring East Sussex. Army wife Charley Tomlinson, her husband Patrick and their four children are hoping to leave Sandhurst behind for a place to call their own, while Simon and Tina Haben want to trade in their one-bedroom flat in London for a more family friendly house within commuting distance of the capital.(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Documentary examining the famous Second World War evacuation of Allied soldiers - codenamed Operation Dynamo - from the beaches of Dunkirk, France, between May 26 and June 4, 1940. Recently released Ministry of Defence files reveal that, far from being absent as many historians have believed, the RAF was suffering massive losses supporting the evacuation. Operating at high altitude and deep inside France, RAF planes were halting the bulk of Luftwaffe bombers before they could reach the beaches. The files also reveal that the famous Spitfire took flight for the first time during the mission, and the agile fighter was a spectacular success.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 58-year-old woman is brought into the hospital after being run over by a lorry, suffering severe blood loss. Doctors are concerned that nerves and tissue in her leg may have suffered irreparable damage. Meanwhile, a 65-year-old man is treated after falling from a loft ladder, and a mischievous 85-year-old shows signs of severe dehydration.(n)

programme.title: Dark Water
programme.desc: Directed by Walter Salles Jr., this remake of Hideo Nakata's supernatural psychological drama Honogurai Mizuno Soko Kara revolves around the plight of a single mother (Jennifer Connelly) whose messy divorce and subsequent battle for the custody of her five-year-old daughter is taking a heavy toll on her emotional well-being. Ultimately, the mother and daughter are able to relocate to an apartment, which, despite its excessively dilapidated interior, seems to be an adequate location for beginning a new life. Before long, however, what appears to be the spirit of a young girl begins to haunt them. No stranger to mental illness, the wary young woman brushes the visions aside as part of the inherent stress of making the transition from housewife to working, single mom. As time goes by and the apparent haunting does not subside, the apartment's new residents are forced to examine the history of its former tenants. Dark Water also features performances from John C. Reilly, Tim Roth, and Dougray Scott(n)

programme.title: Lights Out
programme.desc: A supernatural being that can only be seen when the lights go out attacks a family and one of them has to step up to protect the others(n)

programme.title: Stealing Beauty
programme.desc: After her mother commits suicide, nineteen year old Lucy Harmon travels to Italy to have her picture painted. However, she has other reasons for wanting to go. She wants to renew her acquaintance with Nicolo Donati, a young boy with whom she fell in love on her last visit four years ago. She also is trying to solve the riddle left in a diary written by her dead mother, Sara(n)

programme.title: The Man From U.N.C.L.E.
programme.desc: In this spy thriller set in the early 1960s, CIA agent Napoleon Solo and KGB operative Illya Kuryakin team up to stop an international criminal organisation that is trafficking nuclear weapons and technology. Adaptation of the TV series of the same name(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: Comic jewels Tina Fey and Amy Poehler, who once shared the "Saturday Night Live" stage, reunite in this outrageous romp. Fey's a buttoned-down career woman who agrees to let loopy working-class girl Poehler become the surrogate mother of her child. Steve Martin costars as Fey's New Age health-food entrepreneur boss, and Sigourney Weaver is hilarious as a smug director of the surrogacy agency. Written and directed by Michael McCullers, former writer at "SNL."(n)

programme.title: Semi-Pro
programme.desc: One-hit wonder Jackie Moon uses his musical earnings to buy a basketball team, but must fight to keep his side in the game(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Four
programme.desc: Brilliant scientist Reed Richards builds a device that allows users to teleport to an alternate dimension, but an experiment involving it goes wrong and leaves him and his three teammates with unusual superpowers. The quartet are then forced to work together to battle an enemy from their past. This reboot of the iconic Marvel superhero team stars Miles Teller as Richards (who becomes Mr. Fantastic, able to bend and stretch his body into impossible shapes), Michael B. Jordan as Johnny Storm (aka the Human Torch, whose body can erupt in flames), Kate Mara as Sue Storm (aka the Invisible Woman -- no explanation needed), and Jamie Bell as Ben Grimm (who is transformed into the rock monster known as The Thing). Directed by Josh Trank, who previously worked with Jordan on the superhero film Chronicle(n)

programme.title: The Take
programme.desc: In this thrilling action flick set in Paris, a maverick CIA agent forges an unlikely bond with a pickpocket as they investigate a terrorist conspiracy targeting the city's Bastille Day celebrations(n)

programme.title: I Am Legend
programme.desc: The film revolves around virologist Robert Neville, who is immune to a man-made virus that was created to cure cancer but has now killed 90% of the human population. He lives in New York and is working on the cure for the virus while defending himself against mutants that have been created by the virus(n)

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection
programme.desc: A hit man is forced to commit three difficult killings in order to rescue his kidnapped lover(n)

programme.title: The Pianist
programme.desc: A gifted classical musician struggles to survive in the Warsaw ghetto during the Holocaust in this harrowing look at Nazi brutality and one man's fight for survival(n)

programme.title: Race
programme.desc: Exhilarating biopic of legendary black Olympian Jesse Owens (Stephan James) and his inspiring journey to overcome racism at home and abroad, culminating in his triumphant track and field performance at the 1936 Berlin Olympics under the tutelage of gruff Ohio State coach Larry Snyder (Jason Sudeikis) and the skeptical gaze of Adolf Hitler(n)

programme.title: All the President's Men
programme.desc: A powerful reconstruction of the Watergate investigation which led to the most sensational political scandal of the 1970s. Introduced by Brian Reddin(n)

programme.title: Tetro
programme.desc: On the heels of the self-financed, modestly budgeted 2007 drama Youth Without Youth -- his first directorial outing after a ten-year hiatus -- filmmaker Francis Ford Coppola remains situated in the director's chair for this semi-autobiographical family drama concerning an artistic family of immigrants whose fierce rivalries span several generations. Vincent Gallo stars with newcomer Alden Ehrenreich, with Carmen Maura, Maribel Verdú, and Alden Ehrenreich rounding out the cast(n)

programme.title: Prelude to a Kiss
programme.desc: A pessimistic designer (Meg Ryan) marries her dream man (Alec Baldwin) but an innocent kiss from an older man results in a surprising fantastical twist(n)

programme.title: Bachelor Party
programme.desc: Easygoing bus driver Rick is ready to get hitched to wealthy Debbie. But his pals won't let him get away without the messiest stag night of the decade. Raucous comedy(n)

programme.title: Say Anything...
programme.desc: A beautiful and brilliant high school student finds herself pursued romantically by a charming but totally unambitious fellow student(n)

programme.title: Welcome to Mooseport
programme.desc: When ex-President Monroe Cole retires to a small town, the locals invite him to run for mayor. Plumber 'Handy' Harrison is planning to run too. Cole persuades Harrison to stand down, but when the statesman starts to romance Handy's girlfriend, the plumber re-enters the race(n)

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: JM Barrie was the Scottish playwright who was inspired to write Peter Pan after befriending Sylvia and her three small children. Magical family drama nominated for seven Academy Awards(n)

As he endeavours to come to terms with his new-found abilities, he is also forced to contend with a maniac villain known as the Green Goblin(n)

programme.title: Wish I Was Here
programme.desc: In this touching comedy-drama, a 35-year-old father who's never quite grown up learns about life when he's forced to homeschool his kids, since their grandfather can no longer afford their private-school tuition and their public school is a mess(n)

programme.title: Anything Else
programme.desc: Romantic comedy written and directed by Woody Allen. Jerry is an aspiring comedy writer living in New York City with his neurotic girlfriend. He is having difficulty getting his career off the ground, not least because of his incompetent agent and increasingly paranoid mentor. His life becomes even more complicated when his girlfriend's mother - who harbours ambitions of becoming a cabaret singer - moves in(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Singer
programme.desc: In this fun return to the fashion-challenged 1980s, aspiring rock 'n' roller Robbie Hart (Sandler) has a regular gig singing at weddings and a fiancée who's about to break his heart. When he's left at the altar at his own wedding, he becomes a newlyweds' worst nightmare ... until he realises he's free to rescue the woman he really loves (Barrymore) from her boorish fiancé. Starring Adam Sandler & Drew Barrymore(n)

programme.title: To Be or Not to Be
programme.desc: A Polish theatre troupe get caught up in the Nazi invasion and try to run rings around the occupying forces(n)

programme.desc: Set in 1959, Diner shows how five young men resist their adulthood and seek refuge in their beloved Diner(n)

Castle senses her protestations of innocence are true and works to find the real culprit. Meanwhile, after being dismissed by the FBI, Beckett discovers she cannot get her job back with the NYPD due to a freeze on hiring new staff. American crime drama, starring Nathan Fillion and Stana Katic.(n)

programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of a struggling actress in what appears to have been a bungled robbery. When a couple produce a video tape showing the thieves at work, the detectives waste little time in tracking down their suspects. Legal drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.desc: Two thieves discover the skeletal remains of a woman who was believed to have died in the September 11 attacks on the World Trade Centre. programme.desc: A suspected carjacker is murdered and the team believes he may have been involved in drug smuggling. To complicate matters, evidence suggests that Ryan, who is now working for local TV, could have inadvertently led the killer to his victim, a possibility that further distances him from his former colleagues. Crime drama, starring David Caruso.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents examine the death of a seaman and find themselves working alongside Barrett. Meanwhile, Ziva introduces her new boyfriend to her team-mates. Crime drama, guest starring Enrique Murciano.(n)

programme.desc: Drama following the fortunes of Olivia Lockhart, a small-town judge, both inside and away from the courtroom.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: New York's district attorneys investigate the mysterious death of a stockbroker who was dating the daughter of a ruthless cosmetics mogul - and find themselves caught up in a wrangle over whether HRT withdrawal can be used as a defence in law. Police drama, guest starring Lucie Arnaz, with Jerry Orbach and Sam Waterston.(n)

programme.desc: Nick and Riley investigate an attack on a skydiver who was critically injured when his parachute failed to open. Elsewhere, Langston struggles to solve the death of a religious fanatic in the desert as Brass questions the prime suspect, one of the victim's followers. George Eads stars.(n)

Under the guidance of therapist Dr Rachel Cranston, his memory begins to return and suspicion falls on his ex-lover EJ Barrett. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Sarah Jane Morris.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The investigators examine the death of US marine Tommy Hill, who appears to have been fatally stabbed en route to a homecoming party thrown in his honour by his foster family. McGee and Ziva follow a trail of blood that leads them to a mobile phone, while Abby discovers the victim had been trying to hack into Virginia's state website and Ducky's autopsy reveals that Hill had been injected with a sedative.(n)

programme.desc: New series. Lindsay is questioned by Commander Crowley, who has discovered that she and Voight were in the same location on the night of the killer's disappearance.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

Crime drama, starring Jeff Goldblum and Julianne Nicholson.(n)

programme.desc: A man in a fancy-dress knight's costume is found stabbed with a lance in Central Park, and evidence suggests the victim had been jousting before his death. programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: A murder victim is discovered with her eyelids removed, leading Mac to suspect the involvement of a recently released serial killer who mutilated people in the same gruesome fashion. Stella learns the results of her HIV test, while Danny and Hawkes investigate the case of a man poisoned with ricin. Gary Sinise stars.(n)

programme.desc: CIU infiltrates a gang of masked bank robbers who are stealing money and killing security guards. Sent undercover, DC Price's focus is blurred when the leader's girlfriend starts flirting with him - and her partner is as possessive as he is unpredictable. Guest starring Neal McDonough (Desperate Housewives, Justified).(n)

However, Ziva and the team discover her supposed assailant actually died of a heart attack days before the crime was committed. Meanwhile, suspicions are raised regarding the eyeball left in Tony's drink, and the investigators' attention is fixed on the port-to-port murderer, who appears to still be at large.(n)

programme.title: Cedar Cove

programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the fatal stabbing of a taxi driver whose body was left under his vehicle. The finger of suspicion points to a man who took a drunken ride in the cab on the same night - an ex-convict who is also a gifted writer - and his protege, whose fingerprints were found on a book and cigar left at the scene. Saul Rubinek, JK Simmons and Sonia Braga guest star alongside Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

Featuring cameos by the stars of genre shows, including Battlestar Galactica's Grace Park and Kate Vernon, and Babylon 5's Joshua Cox.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: US Navy lieutenant Paul Booth is shot dead while sitting on a park bench. It turns out that the last people he called were his boss, his wife and Penelope Langston - a rebellious academic who also happens to be McGee's grandmother. She says that the victim was an old student of hers who kept in touch, but later reveals she was recruited to work on a special project during the Vietnam War by the head of a top-secret think tank Booth was a member of. Guest starring Lily Tomlin, with Mark Harmon and Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia(n)

programme.desc: 'The Karate Kid' is not just the story of a boy's revenge on his tormentors but of his becoming a man. To look for vengeance only, young Daniel is told by his mentor and spiritual father, Miyagi, to dig two graves. Miyagi refuses to teach Daniel what he wants to know. Only when he acquires the spiritual as well as physical maturity - when he learns that karate is not just fighting - will Daniel be ready to challenge the brutal champion to a contest in which, he is warned, 'accidents can happen'(n)

programme.title: The Karate Kid Part II
programme.desc: The Karate Kid and his elderly mentor Miyagi travel to Okinawa in this sequel to the 1985 martial-art hit. They soon find themselves forced to battle a hot-headed karate expert and an evil real-estate developer to save Miyagi's family from eviction(n)

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: Red Dirt. News of incoming danger spreads throughout the community, as Madison struggles to keep everyone together. Meanwhile, Nick grapples with a hard truth(n)

programme.title: The Express
programme.desc: Rob Brown gives a stellar performance in this winning fact-based sports biopic. He plays Syracuse University running back Ernie Davis, the first African-American to win the Heisman Trophy as the outstanding college-football player in the nation in 1961. Dennis Quaid costars as Syracuse coach Ben Schwartzwalder. Directed by Gary Fleder. The screenplay is by Charles Leavitt, who based it on the book "Ernie Davis: The Elmira Express," written by Syracuse alumnus Robert C. Gallagher(n)

programme.title: Tron
programme.desc: Hacker Jeff Bridges is drawn into a computerised world where he must do battle with rogue programs in order to escape(n)

programme.title: Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Kevin Costner stars in this epic western biopic chronicling the life of legendary lawman Wyatt Earp, from Dodge City to the shootout at the OK Corral(n)

programme.title: Tremors
programme.desc: Based on the cult-favorite "giant worm" film of the same name, the weekly, hour-long Tremors: The Series found Michael Gross repeating his screen role as neurotic worm-buster Burt Gummer. The series took place in the ironically yclept community of Perfection Valley, NV, where all manner of huge and slimy creatures have wrought havoc from beneath the ground. In the tradition of Roswell, NM, Perfection Valley has profited mightily from its disastrous past experiences with such slithery species as the Graboids, the Shriekers, and the AssBlasters, with ex-hippie Nancy Sterngood (Marcia Strassman) growing wealthy by selling ceramic statues of the aforementioned creatures over the Internet, and hot rodder-cum-pilot Tyler Reed (Victor Browne) managing the lucrative "Desert Jack's Graboid Tours." Also on the premises was Department of the Interior agent W.D. Twitchell (Dean Norris), whose job it was to put up bureaucratic barriers against killing off the various and sundry super-worms because of their "endangered species" status. Meanwhile, Burt Gummer, often working in concert with grocer Jodi Chang (Lela Lee) and rancher Rosalita Sanchez (Gladys Jimenez), did his best to protect Perfection Valley from any and all future creepy-crawly invaders -- and when the worms came out anyway (as they always did), Burt utilized a veritable arsenal of jerry-built weaponry to thwart the yucky scourges. Tremors: The Series debuted over cable's Sci-Fi Channel (surprise, surprise!) on March 28, 2003(n)

programme.title: Pan
programme.desc: An orphan boy discovers his destiny as Peter Pan in this fantasy prequel, as he is whisked away to an enchanted land to battle the fearsome pirate Blackbeard with the help of the warrior woman Tiger Lily and his friend James Hook(n)

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: In this harrowing historical drama set in the winter of 1820, the crew of the New England whaling ship the Essex struggle to survive after an attack by a rogue sperm whale leaves them stranded at sea for 90 days(n)

programme.title: 28 Days Later
programme.desc: Danny Boyle's horror film begins with animal activists releasing monkeys from a research laboratory, little knowing they carry a fatal virus, the 'rage'. Twenty-eight days later, bike courier Jim awakes from a traffic accident-induced coma to find London a deserted ruin, populated by the blood-seeking undead. Meeting up with the uninfected Selena, Frank and Hannah, they set off in Frank's taxi to Manchester, where a group of soldiers led by Major Henry West offer a safe haven. But after surviving the terrors of the journey, on arriving at the encampment, their troubles are just beginning..(n)

programme.title: Enter the Dragon
programme.desc: A martial arts master uses a tournament to infiltrate the island fortress of a one-armed drug baron. Action(n)

programme.title: Lights Out
programme.desc: A supernatural being that can only be seen when the lights go out attacks a family and one of them has to step up to protect the others(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: Based on a novel by Elleston Trevor, director John Moore's The Flight of the Phoenix is a remake of a 1965 film of the same name starring film icon James Stewart. The story revolves around the plight of Captain Frank Towns (Dennis Quaid), a pilot whose C-119 cargo plane full of oil workers could not withstand the violent winds of a desert sandstorm. Stranded in the harsh terrain of Mongolia's Gobi Desert (a departure from the original, in which the plane crashed in the Sahara), Frank and his navigator face an equal challenge in maintaining order among the survivors. The group of oilmen had planned on an uneventful trip to shut off a group of rigs falling below their productivity expectations -- not fending for their very lives. Before long, some men are revealed as cowards, while others exhibit a surprising show of strength, all the while hoping that the wreckage of the original plane can be salvaged before a Lord of the Flies situation occurs. Miranda Otto is featured in a supporting role, as well as Giovanni Ribisi and Tyrese Gibson(n)

programme.title: Double Impact
programme.desc: One twin is a gun smuggler, the other an aerobics tutor. Separated at birth, they share only one thing: the desire for revenge on the Hong Kong hoodlum who killed their parents(n)

programme.title: Tremors
programme.desc: Tongue-in-cheek horror tale in which a small Nevada desert town is terrorised by giant man-eating worms. Two handymen are forced to postpone their plans to escape their humdrum lives after several mysterious deaths and a series of earthquakes turn out to be the work of predatory subterranean creatures which lay siege to the terrified townsfolk(n)

programme.title: Vigilante Diaries
programme.desc: A team of crime fighters travel the globe as they battle a group of spies, the Armenian mob, and a trio of mysterious women with dark intentions. This action flick was directed by Christian Sesma, and stars Michael Madsen (Reservoir Dogs), Jason Mewes (Clerks), and Quinton "Rampage" Jackson (The A-Team)(n)

programme.title: Tango & Cash
programme.desc: Two talented drug cops who don't get along are framed by a powerful dealer and must work together to escape a prison controlled by the bad guy's minions and then get revenge on him(n)

programme.title: WarGames
programme.desc: Matthew Broderick stars in John Badham's thriller as a high school student who uses his computer skills to hack into the college computer to improve his grades. After further developing his skills, he attempts to hack into a video company's site for a preview of their latest game. But he accidentally gets into a military computer that co-ordinates early warning systems and the launch of nuclear weapons. Thinking he has found the game, Broderick starts playing, but the end result could be World War III..(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves
programme.desc: Romantic action adventure based on the legendary nobleman-turned-outlaw. On his return from the Crusades, the rebel learns that his father has been murdered by the tyrannical Sheriff of Nottingham and embarks on a campaign of guerrilla warfare to protect the King's throne. The outlaw counts upon the support of his band of followers, including his Moorish companion, a drunken priest and the beautiful Maid Marian(n)

programme.title: National Treasure
programme.desc: Ben finds the map to a secret treasure hidden by America's founding fathers. He wants to protect the hoard from greedy Ian, and the only way to save it is to beat Ian to the prize(n)

programme.title: The Forest
programme.desc: Set in the Aokigahara Forest, which is a place where people commit suicides, a young American woman, Sara, is in search of her twin sister, who has mysteriously disappeared in the forest. Despite the warnings from the villagers, Sara travels into the ghost-filled forest to save her sister to discover the truth while being confronted by angry and tormented souls of the dead that prey on anyone who crosses their paths(n)

programme.desc: Si King visits the show garden designed for blind veterans, Dave Myers learns about growing cocktail ingredients and chef Adrian Luckie makes his signature jerk chicken.(n)

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: When a post office is raided by two knifemen, the owner takes them on so his employees can escape. A man gets his comeuppance after robbing an elderly woman.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Tim Wonnacott presents the competition from Hay-on-Wye, Powys, where teams are guided by experts Charles Hanson and Jonathan Pratt through plenty of highs and lows. Meanwhile, the presenter stumbles across an interesting find with a well-travelled past.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces further coverage from the All England Club, as the second-round matches continue in the men's and ladies' singles. Two of the more notable clashes in the bottom half of the men's draw scheduled to take place today are Juan Martin del Potro v Ernests Gulbis, and Adam Pavlasek v Novak Djokovic, and they are made all the more enticing by the fact that should Del Potro and Djokovic overcome their respective opponents, it will set up an intriguing clash between the pair in round three. Djokovic's pedigree on the grass courts of Wimbledon is excellent, having won the tournament three times, most recently in 2015, and despite struggling to find his best form this year, he did triumph at the AEGON International in Eastbourne last week, in preparation for this year's Grand Slam.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Angela Scanlon present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Abi learns of Steven's intentions to spy on Lauren using the camera on her phone charger and questions why he is bothering when he could just have her instead. Louise is put out to learn Alexandra is taking her place in the showcase, Sonia meets Bex's school teacher to check on her daughter's progress and Max takes Carmel for a drink at the Vic. Karen starts work as a cleaner at Beale's and Robbie searches desperately for Dot's missing cat.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Lawrence and Kev visit a second-hand car dealer who sold a vehicle with a dangerous flaw, and pay a visit to a technology company with a High Court writ. Ken Warby takes on one of the UK's biggest companies. But he has to find them first. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: New series. The genealogy documentary follows 10 more celebrities as they trace their family trees to uncover facts about their heritage. First up is actor Charles Dance, who has made his name playing aristocrats - a far cry from his own background, having been born to a parlour maid. He wants to know if he comes from a long line of servants or if he can uncover some grander origins. The actor is also determined to find out about his father, who died when he was four and about whom he knows hardly anything - a search that takes him to the other side of the world.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the debate from Burton-upon-Trent. The panel comprises Conservative MP Jacob Rees-Mogg, Labour's Shadow Justice Secretary Richard Burgon, Green Party co-leader Caroline Lucas, Mirror columnist Susie Boniface and David Cameron's former director of communications Craig Oliver. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: This Week
programme.desc: Andrew Neil introduces a round-table chat, in which he, Michael Portillo and other guests take a look back at the past seven days' political and parliamentary developments.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Crimewatch Roadshow
programme.desc: Tina Daheley and Rav Wilding appeal for the public's help with unsolved crimes. The team follows an operation to crack down on counterfeit goods in south Wales. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin tour properties in Mountain Ash in south Wales, Elstree in Hertfordshire and Newport in Shropshire, then talk to the new owners about their renovation plans, before cameras return to see how they have got on.(n)

programme.title: Kitchen Garden Live with the Hairy Bikers
programme.desc: Charlotte Ritchie, Call the Midwife's Barbara Gilbert, joins Si King and Dave Myers to enjoy some food in the sun at The Hampton Court Palace Flower Show. Plus, Dave gets a tour around another show-stopping garden featuring incredible edibles and Si gets the low-down on growing garlic. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: The case of an ex-policeman, who decided to use social media to catch the culprit behind the theft of a charity tin. Presented by Dominic Littlewood.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from the city of York, as two teams call upon the services of experts Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt as they peruse the contents of two antique centres, investing a total of £300 on items they hope to profit from at an auction in Darlington.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker is at the All England Club, where the third Grand Slam tournament of the year has reached the third-round stage in the men's and ladies' singles draws. The weather continued to frustrate the players, spectators and organisers last year, leaving the schedule well behind by the end of day five. However, there was still chance for Serena Williams and Roger Federer to progress on Centre Court, with Federer beating Britain's Dan Evans 6-4, 6-2, 6-2 in round three, and Williams surviving a major scare against compatriot Christina McHale in round two.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Comedian and writer Katherine Ryan joins regular host Alex Jones for the final edition of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Sue Barker hosts the light-hearted quiz, with former England batsman James Taylor, Olympic silver medal-winning taekwondo star Lutalo Muhammad, Olympic hockey champion Alex Danson and ex-West Ham United striker Dean Ashton joining Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell in a test of their sporting knowledge.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The Taylors cause trouble in the Square, and later on, Karen comes to a worrying realisation. Steven struggles to stay in control as he continues to spy on Lauren, while Sonia is frustrated with Dot when she refuses to listen to her doctor's advice. Sharon is livid when Louise goes behind her back and talks to Phil about moving schools. Michelle agrees to go on a date with Tom.(n)

programme.title: Count Arthur Strong
programme.desc: Arthur makes some unlikely new friends while in search of biscuits, and sees his life and luck change overnight. Comedy, with Steve Delaney and Rory Kinnear.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer and director recalls an ambitious nationwide challenge for Comic Relief and discusses his involvement in an armed raid with chat show supremo Michael Parkinson. Featuring appearances by This Morning hosts Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: It seems that everyone in the Brown family has a date for Valentine's Day except Agnes, so she turns to the internet to find herself a man. Dermot tries to come up with a loving gesture to prove to Maria he can still be romantic - but he makes the mistake of taking advice from Buster - while Agnes and Winnie are fascinated by Betty's sex manual and Grandad ends up addicted to Viagra. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Seven years into their marriage, Lee and Lucy face the daily onslaught of raising Charlie and his twin siblings, five-year-olds Benji and Molly. Lovably feckless father Frank remains around and close friends including world-weary Toby and uptight ice-queen Anna are still on the scene. Thankfully, Lucy's more dependable parents Geoffrey and Wendy can be relied upon when the going gets tough. However, while juggling the ongoing needs of those around him, the pair disagree about the best way to keep the romance alive. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.(n)

programme.title: Begin Again
programme.desc: A singer-songwriter is left cast adrift when her boyfriend leaves her after becoming a star. While performing in New York's East Village, she meets a record company executive whose career is in tatters, beginning a collaboration that turns both their lives around. Comedy drama, starring Keira Knightley and Mark Ruffalo.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Stephen K Amos joins Brian Conley to look back at the TV shows that shaped him, and led him to become a comedian. From the singing pigs Pinky and Perky, to the terrifying Tales of the Unexpected by way of entertainer Danny la Rue, Stephen's early small-screen influences are wide and varied - but why does he believe he owes his entire career to TV adverts for vacuum cleaners?.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team advise on what to look for among the best of British objects, plus a follow-up with one visitor who put the proceeds of their sale to interesting use.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Tim Wonnacott oversees proceedings as two teams search for antiques at the East of England Showground in Peterborough, with the help of experts Christina Trevanion and Thomas Plant.(n)

programme.title: Bake Off: Creme de la Creme
programme.desc: Angus Deayton hosts the grand final of the pastry chef contest, with the contestants spending eight hours preparing specially themed desserts with an elaborate sculptural centrepiece for a party attended by more than 100 guests at Firle Place, Sussex. Judges Cherish Finden and Benoit Blin assess their efforts, and decide who is this year's champion.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Daily Politics

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker is at the All England Club, as day four of the third Grand Slam tournament of the year gets under way, featuring the men's and ladies' second-round matches. Players from the bottom half of the men's draw and the top half of the ladies' draw are expected to be in action today, which means the crowds may well be treated to Milos Raonic v Mikhail Youzhny, Gael Monfils v Kyle Edmund, and Angelique Kerber v Kirsten Flipkens, among others. For Great Britain's Edmund, this is the first time in his career he has progressed to the second round at SW19, and having battled past compatriot Alexander Ward last time out, now faces a stern test in Frenchman Monfils. Meanwhile, as the top seed in the ladies' tournament, Kerber will be expected to overcome the unseeded Flipkens, although the Belgian has shown in the past she is capable of performing well on grass, having reached the semi-finals as recently as 2013.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights of the fourth day's play at the All England Club, where the men's and ladies' second-round singles were scheduled to conclude. Places in the last 32 were at stake with matches in the top half of the ladies' draw and the bottom half of the men's, as the quest to succeed Andy Murray and Serena Williams as champions continued.(n)

programme.title: RHS Hampton Court Palace Flower Show
programme.desc: Further coverage of the annual horticultural event in south-west London. Monty Don tours the new RHS Kitchen Garden, and Joe Swift takes a look around a garden designed for blind veterans. Carol Klein sees the different varieties on display in the Rose Marquee, Nick Bailey reveals the science behind scent and Adam Frost continues his series looking at how best to use plants in a dream garden.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis look back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Hal Cruttenden, Ed Gamble and Zoe Lyons. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by James O'Brien.(n)

programme.title: George Best: All By Himself
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of the reserved young football prodigy from Belfast who became a global superstar, but whose career was blighted by his battle with the pressures of fame. The film reveals how the player dubbed El Beatle helped Manchester United to win two league titles and the European Cup, but his extravagant lifestyle led to various problems, most notably alcoholism.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Big Continental Road Trip
programme.desc: The Bake Off judge concludes his trip in France, as he tries to find out what makes the country tick when it comes to cars. Paul's six-day road trip begins in Paris, where he is joined for the day by the host of French Top Gear, Philippe Lellouche. In a classic Citroen DS, they set off through the rain and experience the joys of Parisian traffic jams and the mayhem which is the roundabout around the Arc de Triomphe. The final day sees Paul travel to Magny-Cours racing circuit to meet two Formula 1 legends and Jean Pierre Jabouille, the man who drove the first F1 turbo car.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ireland: The Edge of the World
programme.desc: Part two of two. Colin Stafford-Johnson heads north from Clew Bay for Donegal - golden eagle country - before reaching the island's northern tip and turning east along the coast of Northern Ireland. Along the way he observes the whooper swans that fly in every autumn to escape the Arctic winter and the elusive pine marten, an animal resident in the area since the last Ice Age. Basking sharks, bats and salmon are among the other creatures Colin comes across as he seeks out the remotest corners of Ireland's wild west.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Writer and comedy actor Adil Ray joins Brian Conley to discuss the shows of his youth, and to explain how the Liverpool-set Bread inspired him to create Asian sitcom Citizen Khan.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: A selection of some of the more unusual items featured on the programme. Plus, Paul Martin meets the stonemasons breathing new life into Oxford's dreaming spires.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants a tree fern in the damp garden and uses netting to protect his soft fruits from birds. Carol Klein selects hardy geraniums as her Plant of the Month, Flo Headlam visits an inspiring church garden in Lewisham that feeds both the mind and body, and Nick Bailey gets an insight into the impact of parasitoid wasps on gardens.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces the opening coverage of day five at the All England Club, where the men's and ladies' third-round singles matches are due to get under way. The rain intervened on day five last year to leave most of the matches unplayed, contributing to the decision to play on the middle Sunday for only the fourth time in Wimbledon history. The roof on Centre Court came into its own though, with Stan Wawrinka left cursing the draw, as he faced the unseeded Juan Martin del Potro, who was continuing his recovery from injury. This second-round match was finely poised throughout, but the Argentine secured the third set on a tie-break before going on to defeat the fourth seed in four sets. Another match that was in doubt for most of its duration was the only one to finish on Court One, as former champion Venus Williams edged through against Daria Kasatkina, winning 10-8 in the final set.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents highlights of the fifth day's play at the All England Club, where the third-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles were due to get under way. The players will have been eager to complete their fixtures today, which would give them a full weekend off to prepare for the last 16 on Monday, and a break from the intensity of the third Grand Slam tournament of the year.(n)

programme.title: RHS Hampton Court Palace Flower Show
programme.desc: Arit Anderson and Mark Lane take a look at the show gardens designed to deliver powerful messages, while Monty Don meets the designer who is greening up Britain's brownfield spaces. Nick Bailey investigates how best to care for orchids, and Toby Buckland discovers the best house plants at the show. Carol Klein reveals the pollinators best suited to British gardens, whilst Rachel de Thame meets the team putting Australasian plants on the map in the UK. Adam Frost concludes his masterclass on how plants can maximise viewers' own gardens design credentials. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Lake
programme.desc: Twelve-year-old Tui Mitcham walks out into a lake on New Zealand's South Island, but is saved before she freezes or drowns. She is found to be pregnant and local police call in child-protection specialist Robin Griffin, a detective based in Australia who is in the area to visit her sick mother. Thriller co-written by Oscar winner Jane Campion, starring Elisabeth Moss, Peter Mullan and Holly Hunter.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days+
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Mike Read and Janice Long present the February 23 show, featuring Hot Chocolate, Rockwell, Nik Kershaw, Carmel and Howard Jones.(n)

programme.title: Castles - Britain's Fortified History
programme.desc: Historian Sam Willis charts how Edward I turned the castle into an instrument of colonisation. He spent a large amount of money on subduing the Welsh and built fearsome fortresses in Caernarfon, Gwynedd and Beaumaris, which were used to impose England's rule on the country. However, when the king's attention turned to Scotland, his plans didn't go as expected.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Strange Signals from Outer Space!.
programme.desc: The scientists scouring the universe for signs of extraterrestrial life, including the film researchers at the Green Bank Telescope searching for radio signals from 'Tabby's Star', a star so mysterious some scientists believe it might be surrounded by a Dyson Sphere - a vast energy collector built by advanced aliens. The film also features the 2006 discovery by husband and wife team Duncan Lorimer and Maura McLaughlin of an enigmatic signal from space, known as a fast radio burst, and its subsequent explanations.(n)

programme.title: Aliens: The Big Think
programme.desc: The search for extraterrestrials is no longer sci-fi - it is a question engaging some of the greatest minds in science. This documentary gets inside the minds of scientists exploring the possibilities of what could be out there, including Professor Martin Rees, the Astronomer Royal, who thinks the common idea of organic aliens is all wrong.(n)

programme.title: Guts: The Strange and Wonderful World of the Human Stomach
programme.desc: TV presenter Michael Mosley takes part in an experiment at the Science Museum in London, where a small pill camera takes viewers on a journey through his digestive system. He visits a gastroenterologist, who explains the link between personality and pain response, and learns about the advent of faecal transplants increasingly used to treat people with serious stomach and bowel disorders.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Mike Read and Janice Long present the February 23 show, featuring Hot Chocolate, Rockwell, Nik Kershaw, Carmel and Howard Jones.(n)

programme.title: What Ever Happened to Rock 'n' Roll
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne leads a discussion from London's 100 Club asking whether rock 'n' roll is in crisis and what it represents in contemporary society. Can the genre still be considered as dangerous and subversive as it once was or has it become more about lifestyle and decoration? Participants include Savages' lead singer Jehnny Beth, Dr John Cooper Clarke and former Animal Eric Burdon. There are also contributions from Noel Gallagher and Dave Grohl and the members of Sleaford Mods and Alabama Shakes.(n)

programme.title: Castles - Britain's Fortified History
programme.desc: Historian Sam Willis charts how Edward I turned the castle into an instrument of colonisation. He spent a large amount of money on subduing the Welsh and built fearsome fortresses in Caernarfon, Gwynedd and Beaumaris, which were used to impose England's rule on the country. However, when the king's attention turned to Scotland, his plans didn't go as expected.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Strange Signals from Outer Space!.
programme.desc: The scientists scouring the universe for signs of extraterrestrial life, including the film researchers at the Green Bank Telescope searching for radio signals from 'Tabby's Star', a star so mysterious some scientists believe it might be surrounded by a Dyson Sphere - a vast energy collector built by advanced aliens. The film also features the 2006 discovery by husband and wife team Duncan Lorimer and Maura McLaughlin of an enigmatic signal from space, known as a fast radio burst, and its subsequent explanations.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: John Peel and David Jenson introduce performances by Matt Bianco, Van Halen, Alexei Sayle, Break Machine, Wang Chung, Slade, Nena and Julia & Company. First shown March 1, 1984.(n)

programme.title: Becoming a Lied Singer: Thomas Quasthoff and the Art of German Song
programme.desc: Drawing on his multiple roles as maestro, teacher and founder of the Das Lied International singing competition, Thomas Quasthoff takes audiences on a personal journey into this short, but intensely expressive art form. He focuses on Franz Schubert as the first great Lieder writer, and in Hamburg delves into the life and work of Johannes Brahms, a composer he feels a great empathy with. The programme includes rare archive footage of Thomas performing with pianist Andras Schiff in 2003 (prior to his retirement from the classical stage), as well as a newly restored telerecording of Thomas's Lied singing hero, Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau.(n)

programme.title: Rock 'n' Roll Guns for Hire: The Story of the Sideman
programme.desc: Earl Slick, David Bowie's sideman of 40 years, looks at the men and women behind some of the greatest songs of the 20th and 21st century. The sidemen are often the forgotten `guns for hire' that changed musical history and this documentary reveals what it feels like to live in the shadow of a star, a story of triumph and thwarted ambition. Contributors include Mick Jagger, Keith Richards and Billy Joel, as well as sidemen past and present for Prince, David Bowie, John Lennon, Otis Redding, the Rolling Stones and Beyonce.(n)

programme.title: Girls in Bands at the BBC
programme.desc: Compilation of performances by some of the best female musicians in rock, from the 1970s to the present day. Artists featured include American rock group Fanny, the powerful vocals of Elkie Brooks on Vinegar Joe's Proud to Be a Honky Tonk Woman, the poetry of Patti Smith's Horses and upbeat energy of the Go-Go's on We Got the Beat.(n)

programme.title: The Genius of David Bowie
programme.desc: A compilation showcasing some of the musician's performances from the BBC archives, including Space Oddity, Life on Mars?, Fashion and The Jean Genie. Plus, Lulu and Mott the Hoople perform Bowie songs, and there are further clips featuring the star's musical collaborators Iggy Pop and Lou Reed.(n)

programme.title: Formula E: Street Racers
programme.desc: This week Street Racers stays in Berlin to meet the stars of tomorrow, learns about how German technology is raising the stakes and Lucas di Grassi reflects on living the dream.(n)

programme.title: Mobil 1: The Grid
programme.desc: This week's show goes behind-the-scenes at the Le Mans 24 Hours, previews Formula One's Austrian Grand Prix and looks at the iconic Colin's Crest at Rally Sweden.(n)

programme.title: Miss Congeniality 2: Armed and Fabulous
programme.desc: FBI agent-turned-reluctant beauty queen Gracie Hart (played by Sandra Bullock) is taking on both bad guys and high glamour again in this sequel to the comedy smash Miss Congeniality. After her undercover mission at the Miss United States pageant becomes public knowledge, Gracie becomes something of a celebrity, and the FBI uses her notoriety to generate positive PR for the bureau; however, Gracie would like to get back to some solid police work, especially after scuffling with fellow female agent "Sam" Fuller (Regina King), who isn't impressed with Gracie. Despite their differences, the two find themselves working side by side when two of Gracie's pals from the pageant -- contest winner Cheryl Frasier (Heather Burns) and master of ceremonies Stan Fields (William Shatner) -- fall victim to kidnappers. As she did on the first film, Sandra Bullock served as both producer and star for Miss Congeniality 2: Armed and Fabulous, while director John Pasquin's credits include several episodes of the situation comedy George Lopez, also produced by Bullock(n)

programme.desc: This Secret History documentary tells the story of the unique relationship between two of the most remarkable pioneers of the 20th century - Michael Dillon, the world's first woman to transition to a man, and Roberta Cowell, Britain's first man to become a woman. Both sex changes caused a press sensation in the 1950s, but ultimately ended in tragedy, and this programme includes previously unseen correspondence between Roberta and Michael, discovered by journalist Liz Hodgkinson, which reveals a sensational twist in this extraordinary story.(n)

programme.title: Dispatches

programme.desc: Almost two million Brits took a cruise last year, but how clean is the air on these holidays of a lifetime? Tazeen Ahmad goes undercover to investigate deep concerns about the impact some cruise ships could be having on the environment and public health. Travelling as a passenger on a European cruise, reporter she discovers more about the pollution levels some customers could be exposed to and investigates the wider impact of cruising holidays, from waste flushed straight into the sea to on-shore pollution.(n)
