programme.desc: Snooty King and Queen Marigold invite themselves to dinner at the castle, where they sample Nanny Plum's cooking.(n)

programme.title: Digby Dragon
programme.desc: When Mungo accidently starts up Scottie with Archie on board, Digby realises that he has the chance to be a hero. However, saving Scottie and Archie is far harder than he imagined.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George and Peppa help Mummy Pig tidy up, and learn about recycling.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Bert and Barry the polar bears come to Wissper with a penguin problem - there are so many penguins on the ice that they cannot enjoy a sedate skate.(n)

programme.title: Wanda and the Alien
programme.desc: The friends take a trip to visit Alien's family on the planet Quome, but a sheep causes trouble.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Matthew Wright and the panel debate the day's issues before opening the discussion to the studio audience and inviting viewers to call in or text their opinions.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Tracy Metro advises globetrotters John and Tonette, who cannot sell on their charming Cotswold cottage in the Oxfordshire village of South Newington, because its busy, patterned interior is deterring buyers from making an offer.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother. Featuring games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Jett is determined to bring his parents back together, while Zac declines the job offer for the sake of Hunter, and VJ remains in emotional turmoil, despite Ash's best efforts.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: David lies to his boss to cover his tracks, but Paul is annoyed to learn that Leo has put David's career in jeopardy. Aaron starts to waver on a business deal with Mishti.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: As the hunt for La Grenouille intensifies, Tony's cover is blown and his car is later destroyed in an explosion, leaving the team convinced he has been killed. However, Ducky's autopsy on the body of the driver reveals it was actually someone else who died in the blast.(n)

programme.title: Jodi Picoult's Salem Falls
programme.desc: A former teacher is forced to give up his career and move to a new town after he is falsely accused of sexual assault against a student. He ends up facing the same situation again when three malicious teenage girls claim he raped one of them, but resolves to prove his innocence in the face of a witch hunt from the community. Crime drama based on Jodi Picoult's novel, starring James Van Der Beek and Sarah Carter. Edited for daytime broadcast.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: David lies to his boss to cover his tracks, but Paul is annoyed to learn that Leo has put David's career in jeopardy. Aaron starts to waver on a business deal with Mishti.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Jett is determined to bring his parents back together, while Zac declines the job offer for the sake of Hunter, and VJ remains in emotional turmoil, despite Ash's best efforts.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: Cricket on 5
programme.sub-title: England v South Africa: First Test Day Two.
programme.desc: England v South Africa. Highlights of the second day's play in the First Test, which took place at Lord's. The Proteas haven't toured England in the longest format of the game since they won a three-game series 2-0 in 2012, with victory sealed by a 51-run triumph in the decisive Third Test on this ground. With commentary by Graeme Smith, Geoffrey Boycott, Simon Hughes, Michael Vaughan and Mark Nicholas.(n)

programme.title: Blind Date
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady seeks a would-be sweetheart for Arnold, who emigrated from Africa to Manchester, and served with the British Army in Afghanistan for nearly five years. Arnold's idea of a perfect date would involve a spin on the London Eye, and Paul gives three ladies a chance to woo the gentlemanly soldier. Meanwhile, finance director Gemma - also from Manchester - seeks an adventurous Prince Charming to settle down and start a family with. Plus, the host catches up with last week's couples, to find out whether that initial spark of attraction could develop into something more.(n)

programme.title: The Best of Bad TV
programme.sub-title: Best of Bad TV: Live & Dangerous.
programme.desc: A collection of major TV howlers, including a fire on the Blue Peter set, famous folk who think they can sing, wardrobe malfunctions and disastrous award shows. There's a lowlight from The National Lottery Jetset as the studio is invaded, Lorraine Kelly being forced off the air, and a wannabe magician impaling the hand of a presenter. Bucks Fizz singer Cheryl Baker has insight into Eurovision's most off-key moments, while John Stapleton recalls The Time, The Place being ambushed. Other contributors include Sarah Cawood, Penny Smith, Dom Joly, Maria McErlane and Matt Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the latest eviction, revealing whether Charlotte, Joe or Tom has been voted out by the public, and chatting to them about their time on the show. But before that, there's the question of seeing how they've all been getting on in the regular round-up.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal and his guests discuss tonight's eviction. He invites the audience and celebrity panel to debate whether the public made the right decision, talks to Emma Willis about the earlier show and then chats to the unlucky contestant who has been kicked out.(n)

programme.title: The Rookie
programme.desc: Nick Pulovski is a cop, presently assigned to the auto theft division. When he discovers that a man named Strom is the brains behind a major car theft and chop shop ring, he sees this as his opportunity to do something big. After his partner is killed, the case is then transferred to homicide, so he is taken off the case. And he is assigned a new partner, a cop who would prefer to play by the rules(n)

programme.title: The Gene Generation
programme.desc: In a future dystopia where thorough DNA scans are required to gain entrance into every major city, a world-class assassin (Bai Ling) is assigned the task of eliminating rogue DNA hackers. The sun has scorched the earth, and now dense clouds hang above overpopulated megacities. Those whose DNA is considered unworthy are locked out of the cities and forced to wander the wastelands. It's Michelle's duty to ensure that no undesirables gain entry into the city, and she earns a substantial paycheck for doing so(n)

programme.title: The Arrival
programme.desc: Astronomer Zane discovers an alien radio signal and when he tries to report it he unearths a sinister conspiracy(n)

programme.title: Constantine
programme.desc: Chain-smoking loner Constantine tries to buy his place in heaven by banishing Earth-bound demons back to hell. But his fate is tied up with Angela, a cop investigating the alleged suicide of her twin. Action(n)

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: An alien traveller, Klaatu, heads to Earth along with his bodyguard robot, Gort, to deliver a warning of planetary destruction if the people of the world fail to stop laying waste to the environment(n)

programme.title: Forgetting Sarah Marshall
programme.desc: A lovelorn composer flies to a Hawaiian resort in hopes of forgetting the woman who broke his heart, only to discover she and her new boyfriend have just checked in(n)

programme.title: Changing Lanes
programme.desc: Atrasado en camino a los tribunales, un abogado se pasa de un carril a otro. En otro carril, un padre cuyo derecho a ver a sus hijos depende de llegar a horario a los tribunales. Un accidente menor convertirá a estos dos extraños en bestias(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way
programme.desc: After serving 5 years of a 30 year prison sentence, Carlito Brigante (Al Pacino) is freed on a legal technicality exploited by his close friend and lawyer, Dave Kleinfeld (Sean Penn). Carlito vowes to be Good.(n)

programme.title: Die Hard With a Vengeance
programme.desc: Things aren't going well for John McClane: his marriage is breaking up, he's been suspended from the force and now the brother of Hans Gruber, the German terrorist he threw off a building a few years back, is threatening to blow up a school if McClane doesn't run around the city solving his demeaning and dangerous puzzles. With the help of Zeus, a Harlem electrician, McClane discovers Gruber's plot to distract the NYPD while he clears the federal bank of billions of dollars of gold(n)

programme.title: 12 Rounds
programme.desc: WWE superstar John Cena stars as Danny Fisher, a New Orleans police detective who must complete a dozen mind-bending puzzles in order to save his beloved fiancée from being murdered by an escaped criminal looking for revenge. Directed by Renny Harlin(n)

programme.title: Cursed
programme.desc: "Scream" director Wes Craven and writer Kevin Williamson reunite for this bloodcurdling chiller. It's the story of siblings (Christina Ricci, Jesse Eisenberg) who are bitten by a mysterious beast, then gradually turn into werewolves. Can they break the deadly curse? Scott Baio and Craig Kilborn have cameos. Joshua Jackson, Portia de Rossi, Shannon Elizabeth, Mya, Kristina Anapau(n)

programme.title: Forgetting Sarah Marshall
programme.desc: A lovelorn composer flies to a Hawaiian resort in hopes of forgetting the woman who broke his heart, only to discover she and her new boyfriend have just checked in(n)

programme.title: How to Be Single
programme.desc: In this hilarious and heartfelt rom com, four women with vastly different ideas about love and relationships navigate the single life of New York City. Two friends set out on a journey of self-discovery, while a career gal struggles with settling down and an uptight romantic searches for her perfect match(n)

programme.title: Coyote Ugly
programme.desc: An aspiring singer-songwriter works in a trendy Manhattan bar where the employees are expected to put on a spirited show for patrons(n)

programme.title: Singles
programme.desc: Cinema One Global provides hours of entertainment for avid followers of Philippine movies, dramas and showbiz. Stay tuned to another great programme!(n)

programme.title: The Second Arrival
programme.desc: Imaginative sequel to the 1996 sci-fi hit, about a computer programmer (Patrick Muldoon) working for the National Space Agency in Montreal. He discovers evidence of an alien conspiracy against Earth, but can't get anyone to believe him. Michael Sarrazin, Jane Sibbett, Catherine Blythe, Michael Scherer. Directed by Kevin Tenney(n)

programme.title: The Signal
programme.desc: Three students seek a notorious hacker in the Nevada desert, and end up imprisoned in a high-tech government-research facility(n)

programme.title: Hellboy II: The Golden Army
programme.desc: Cigar-chomping demon Hellboy (Ron Perlman), the Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense's secret weapon against things that go bump in the night, returns to battle a supernatural prince with an ancient grudge against puny humans. Writer-director Guillermo del Toro's sequel improves on his original, showcasing wickedly elegant monsters and spectacular action sequences(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man 2
programme.desc: The superhero begins to feel the pressure as he juggles college, a relationship, and the responsibilities of his alter ego, who must take on a cyborg(n)

programme.title: Everest
programme.desc: In this adventure docudrama set in 1996, several groups of climbers successfully scale Mount Everest, only to be faced with tragedy when a monster snowstorm surprises them as they attempt to make their descent(n)

programme.title: The Sum of All Fears
programme.desc: Ben Affleck stars as Cia agent Jack Ryan in Paul Alden Robinson's adaptation of Tom Clancy's novel. This time, he's in a race against time to track down the terrorists who've acquired a nuclear weapon and plan to detonate it at the Superbowl while implicating the Russians as the perpetrators, triggering a nuclear exchange(n)

programme.title: Domestic Disturbance
programme.desc: A divorced boat builder discovers that his young son's stepdad is masking an evil side, forcing him to desperately try to protect his ex-wife and son from the new man in their lives(n)

programme.title: The 9th Life of Louis Drax
programme.desc: A young lad survives a catastrophic event on his ninth birthday. A doctor examines the extraordinary accident and the instances that affected his life(n)

programme.title: The Box
programme.desc: Screen siren Cameron Diaz and former X-Man James Marsden star in the supernatural horror picture The Box (2008), directed by Donnie Darko cult fave Richard Kelly. The film's premise involves a strange and ominous box granted to a young couple by a mysterious stranger (Frank Langella). They are informed that pressing various buttons on the box will grant them riches while killing a person unknown to them in the process. Executive produced by Ted Hamm, the film was adapted by Kelly from Richard Matheson's 1970 short story Button, Button(n)

programme.title: Any Given Sunday
programme.desc: Al Pacino delivers an explosive performance as a burnt-out American football coach who finds himself under pressure when the team's owner tries to rejuvenate the losing team(n)

programme.title: Gods of Egypt
programme.desc: A common thief named Bek enlists the help of powerful god Horus in a quest to defeat Set, an evil god who has plunged a once peaceful Egypt into the darkness. The survival of mankind and the fate of his lover lies in the hands of the unlikely mortal hero(n)

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: In this harrowing historical drama set in the winter of 1820, the crew of the New England whaling ship the Essex struggle to survive after an attack by a rogue sperm whale leaves them stranded at sea for 90 days(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Where My Country Gone?. Mr Garrison is fed up with undocumented immigrants, and proposes building a wall to keep them out(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Sarcastaball. Randy is so enraged by South Park Elementary changing the rules of American Football he sarcastically suggests even more changes - be careful, you might just get what you wish for..(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Douche and a Danish. Garrison finally goes too far at a rally and reconsiders his future in politics. Meanwhile, the kids begin searching for an infamous Internet troll; and Gerald joins the opposition to a Danish campaign tracking nefarious characters on the Web(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Cartman Gets an Anal Probe. In the first ever South Park episode, aliens wreak havoc in the Rockies, first by subjecting Cartman to an anal probe, and then by abducting Kyle's baby brother(n)

programme.title: Key & Peele
programme.desc: Non-Stop Party. Sketches include a man who goes to extremes while chasing his girlfriend; and a nonstop party for the electro-pop duo LMFAO(n)

programme.title: Key & Peele
programme.desc: Landlord. The first-season finale features a babysitter dealing with a young Forest Whitaker; an apartment rented by a suspicious landlord; President Obama's desire to be treated like an ordinary citizen; and partygoers trying to liven up a bar mitzvah(n)

programme.title: Key & Peele
programme.desc: Alien Imposters. Sketches in the Season 4 premiere include an alien invasion of Earth; a family reacting to a gay relative's wedding; and surprising views from a couple of racists(n)

programme.desc: Paid Programming(n)

programme.desc: Total Gym Fit is the only piece of fitness equipment you need to get into the best shape of your life! 30 Day Risk-Free Trial for only $14.95. Call today!(n)

programme.title: PiYo Craze!
programme.desc: Define your body with PiYo. Chalene Johnson's new lower-impact workout series combining the muscle-sculpting benefits of Pilates, Yoga and fluid motion all-in-one!(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Point of No Return. In the season finale, J.d. and Elliot start thinking about their future and if they both made a mistake in not being with each other. The Janitor activates the "Brain Trust" to come up with the perfect wedding gift for Elliot(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Own Worst Enemy. J.D.and Elliot contemplate their futures(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Hard Labor. Kim goes into labour as she and J.D. contemplate their future together; Dr. Cox can't bring himself to give his daughter a shot; Turk and Carla obsess over beating a video game; and Dr. Kelso consoles his heartbroken son(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Inconvenient Truth. After watching the eco-movie An Inconvenient Truth, the Janitor vows to save the world by becoming the Environmental Officer at Sacred Heart, but the staff soon discover that his methods of motivation are a bit peculiar. Meanwhile, JD has to face his own inconvenient truth when his brother Dan returns to town and tells him that it's time to grow up(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Identity Crisis. The Janitor challenges J.D. to name everyone in the hospital after it is revealed he only knows them by nickname(n)

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: My Growing Pains. J.D. tries to grow up for the sake of his baby, but Turk resists his new goal. Elsewhere, Dr. Cox gives a patient difficult news, and Elliot plans a birthday party for Kelso, whose real age is revealed(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Who Wants It More. Donna and Eric's tiff leads to a mutual withholding of affection; Red becomes nice after a near death experience; Kelso thinks he saw a UFO(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Fez Gets the Girl. Fez falls for a new girl but is too shy to take action(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Dine and Dash. After receiving a cash gift, Kelso invites the gang to dinner---with the intention of running out on the check(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Radio Daze. Eric pulls Donna's pants down in public and reveals her granny panties to everyone. So he tries to make up by giving her sexy panties on Valentine's Day(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Donna's Panties. On Valentine's Day, Eric compounds an earlier error with Donna; Laurie breaks Kelso's heart; and Fez asks Caroline to go steady(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Romantic Weekend. Trouble starts when Red and Kitty sneak off for a romantic weekend and end up in the same hotel in which Donna and Eric are staying(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Kitty's Birthday (That's Today?!). Kitty is disappointed when everyone except Hyde forgets her birthday(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: The Trials of Michael Kelso. Jackie tests Kelso's relationship capabilities; the boys' prank on a rival school backfires; Bob and Midge don't invite Red and Kitty to their party(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Eric's Naughty No-No. Kittys sisters' success sparks sibling envy; Eric tries to impress Donna with a move from an adult film(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Stage Two. Breast cancer strikes the Archer family---Sterling has it. "I'm trying to stay positive," he says. "I can beat this." But before surgery, he wants to bond with young Seamus (even though he isn't actually the baby's father) and take a Las Vegas vacation(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: Placebo Effect. When Archer discovers that the drugs he has been taking for his breast cancer are actually a mix of sucrose and alcopops, he goes on the trail of a Irish gang running a counterfeit medicine business(n)

programme.title: Archer
programme.desc: El Secuestro. Pam is abducted by kidnappers who mistake her for Cheryl. It seems that Cheryl wasn't completely forthcoming about her background when she applied for her job at ISIS(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: The Sting. Leela has a strange experience after being stung by killer bees while on a mission to collect ordinary honey(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: The Farnsworth Parabox. When the Professor conducts an experiment so hideous that he wants his apparatus destroyed in the thermonuclear inferno of the sun, he has Leela guard the two-foot cubic box overnight so that no one opens it and sets it off. Fry and Bender try their best to sneak a peek but it is Leela who finally gives in and opens the box. Drawn into the power of the box, Leela is thrown into a parallel universe, which has duplicates of the Planet Express gang - including Leela(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: 300 Big Boys. A $300 tax refund buys a whale swim for Leela, youth for the Professor and 100 cups of coffee for Fry, whose caffeine rush comes just in time to avert a disaster(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Spanish Fry. Fry's nose is taken by aliens who consider the "human horn" to be an aphrodisiac. But the pair it's to benefit has deeper relationship problems(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Bend Her. After dominating the Olympics by posing as a fembot, Bender undergoes a sex change to keep his medals. But a celebrity robot falls in love with his new persona(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Sexual Harassment Panda. After a school educational talk from Petey the Panda, Cartman decides to sue Stan for sexual harassment. It doesn't take long for suing fever to grip the entire town!(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: W.T.F. The South Park boys form their own backyard wrestling league, drawing droves of fans more interested in the acting and scripted dramatic storylines than athletic elements(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Tsst. Cartman's mother realizes she can no longer control her son, so attempts to get help from various reality TV experts. Only when she recruits the Dog Whisperer do results start to happen(n)

programme.title: Tosh.0
programme.desc: Phil Davison. Ohio politician Phil Davison gets a Web Redemption; Daniel addresses spam e-mail and tackles a world record(n)

programme.title: Tosh.0
programme.desc: Sex Doll Repairman. A profile of a sex-doll repairman. Also: Daniel proves that everyone's a critic; and learns the pros and cons of being stuck in an elevator(n)

programme.title: Tosh.0
programme.desc: P. Power. Daniel sends money to a stranger on the Internet; and talks to a child with lots of hickeys. Also: a "CeWEBrity Profile"(n)

programme.title: Tosh.0

programme.channel: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)
programme.title: American Justice
programme.sub-title: Body of Evidence: The Tom Capano Trial
programme.desc: Body of Evidence: The Tom Capano Trial. A&E investigates the deadly consequences of unrequited love in the one-hour American Justice: Body of Evidence -- The Tom Capano Trial. Wealthy and well-connected, Tom Capano was still subjected to the torments of the heart. When an affair with Anne Marie Fahey ended badly, he snapped. After murdering his ex-lover, Capano dumped her body in the water, a seemingly clever move. However, Capano never counted on the guilty conscience of his own brother to secure his undoing. The police kept the jealous boyfriend under surveillance until they had the sibling's confession as accomplice. Surprisingly, at trial, Capano himself admitted to removing the body. But, he held onto the claim that Fahey was killed by someone else. Capano was convicted and sentenced to death(n)

Elsewhere, Winston becomes obsessed with learning pop-culture references. Comedy, starring Zooey Deschanel, Jake Johnson and Lamorne Morris, with Lake Bell.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Cece stays the night and convinces Jess that Nick likes her as more than just a flatmate, and deals with amorous advances from Schmidt. Comedy, starring Zooey Deschanel, Hannah Simone, Jake Johnson and Max Greenfield.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Santiago and Diaz investigate Jake's claim that somebody is trying to sabotage his professional life and get him dismissed. Boyle partners up with Hitchcock and Scully to solve a tough case, while Jeffords lies to Gina claiming he and Holt attended her dance troupe's performance. Chris Parnell guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake badly injures himself while chasing down a suspect, but then refuses to take time off from work to recover. Holt and Rosa have an awkward dinner date with their significant others, so they invite Amy and Gina along as well. Andy Samberg stars.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard returns from his research expedition in the North Sea and undergoes an adjustment period with Sheldon. Howard experiences an unusual emotional reaction as a result of his relationship with his mother. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg star.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The friends compete in a scavenger hunt designed by Raj to test their scientific knowledge and life skills, but the game brings out the best and worst in everyone. As the hunt progresses, Howard and Amy begin to bond over their shared musical tastes, while Penny and Sheldon work together as a team and Bernadette becomes fiercely competitive.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: An intoxicated Barney befriends two men after wandering out of his hotel room and decides to show them how to pick up women. Ted and Robin take a walk on the beach and end up having a heart-to-heart chat, while Marshall worries he is experiencing paranormal activity. American sitcom, starring Josh Radnor, Alyson Hannigan and Neil Patrick Harris.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Barney cannot get out of bed on the morning of his wedding due to a major hangover. The gang tries to locate the far-fetched ingredients needed to concoct the famous `Stinson's Hangover Fixer Elixir', so that he can attend a pre-nuptial photoshoot. Starring Neil Patrick Harris.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess realises that Schmidt is responsible for an unfair amount of housework in the apartment, and decides to help him shoulder the burden. When her actions prove unsuccessful, she sets out to cure him of his control issues - only to push him to the other extreme.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jess starts dating the charming father of one of her students, and Nick tries to buy a new mobile phone, while Schmidt and Winston begin a competitive game of bar trivia. Guest starring Dermot Mulroney (My Best Friend's Wedding).(n)

programme.title: 2 Broke Girls
programme.desc: Caroline is torn when she learns the writers at the film studio don't intend to include anything about her friendship with Max when they turn her life story into a movie. Max is thoroughly spoiled by her new crush Randy, who soon sets Caroline up on a date with his friend Bob. Ed Quinn and George Hamilton guest star.(n)

programme.title: 2 Broke Girls
programme.desc: As the girls' Californian adventure continues, Max pet sits for Randy's dog Bruno but the hound escapes while there is a serial killer loose in the neighbourhood. Caroline plans to meet with a famous actress who wants to portray her in the movie of her life story. Ed Quinn guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny makes an important decision after Leonard tries to help her in the aftermath of a failed role on a TV show. Meanwhile, Raj and Stuart practise talking to strangers at a shopping centre, and Sheldon studies to become a comic genius. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon tries to relax after he is forced to take a holiday, and when Penny quits her job the duo end up spending time together. Meanwhile, Leonard struggles to be supportive of his girlfriend's career decision, Bernadette seeks Stuart's help in replacing one of Howard's comic books, and Howard and Raj provide Amy with some advice. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Granny Campbell wants Courtney to come back to Scotland and Grace freaks Warren out, while Darren plans a special foreign film night for Nancy, but when Kyle calls asking for them to visit, he begins to panic.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Erica and Barry get jobs at Spencer's Gifts, then Murray insists Adam get a job as well, but Beverly is adamant that he should focus on film-making.(n)

programme.title: Thor
programme.desc: The Norse god of thunder is banished from his own world when his arrogance puts the kingdom on the brink of war. He is sent to present-day Earth, where he is forced to live among humans without his supernatural powers, but must regain his abilities to defend his new home against his evil brother. Kenneth Branagh's fantasy adventure based on the Marvel comics, starring Chris Hemsworth, Natalie Portman, Tom Hiddleston and Anthony Hopkins.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Favourite Superhero
programme.desc: Documentary making extensive use of interviews and clips from big-budget Hollywood blockbusters to explore the story of how superheroes - once exclusively found on the pages of comic books - found their way to the silver screen, becoming bankable cinematic icons in the process. A Channel 4 poll outlines which do-gooders the British public have taken to their hearts, and the programme charts the history of big-screen heroics from the release of the ground-breaking Superman: The Movie in 1978 through to the high-profile releases arriving in cinemas in 2016. Along the way, viewers are given a chance to revisit Tim Burton's noir-themed iteration of Batman in the 1990s, the angst-filled antics of the X-Men and Spider-Man in the early noughties, and the far-reaching storylines of Marvel's inter-connected Avengers films. All this culminates as the poll results reveals which five heroes have captured British imaginations to become the nation's favourites.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Howard stake their most coveted comic books on a bet over the species of a cricket, while Leonard and Penny struggle to recover from an awkward first night together. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco star.(n)

programme.title: College Football Playoff National Championship
programme.desc: The offensive firepower, excitement and surprises of the 2016 College Football Playoff National Championship at University of Phoenix Stadium in Glendale, Arizona. All of the thrilling plays from Alabama's 45-40 victory over the ACC Conference champion Clemson Tigers are included, as well as analysis from the big game and the postgame trophy presentations. Key moments include Adam Griffith's momentum-shifting second-half onside kick with the score tied at 24 apiece, and two lengthy touchdowns catches from Crimson Tide tight end (and the game's Offensive MVP) O.J. Howard(n)

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship program provides a thorough presentation of sports news, highlights and analysis. The Emmy-winning show revolutionized the sports-news genre by deftly mixing information with irreverence in a hip, daily scrapbook of homers, touchdowns and slam dunks, the perfect clips-and-controversies fix for sports junkies. Staple features besides game scores and highlights include expert breakdowns, 'Top Ten Plays', Web polls and trivia(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Wild Burma: Nature's Lost Kingdom
programme.desc: Film-makers from the BBC's Natural History Unit and scientists from America's Smithsonian Institution venture into Burma's jungles to catalogue its species in the hope of getting protected status for the area. The team sets out to discover whether the mountains in the west are home to a population of Asian elephants that could prove critical to the survival of the species. Gordon Buchanan and Justine Evans search the valleys and ridges, while biologist Ross Piper follows up rumours of a second herd.(n)

programme.title: Conquerors
programme.desc: Documentary examining the pine processionary caterpillar, which is threatening Europe's forests thanks to its ability to defoliate vast tracts of pines.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor travels to South Africa, where he finds himself in shark-infested waters while paddle skiing. He also catches an octopus and tries his hand at reef fishing in a bid to land a huge salmon.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Great Events
programme.desc: The annual migration of wildebeest, gazelles and zebras away from the Serengeti grasslands, and how their departure affects a pride of lions left behind, which struggles to survive without a ready source of prey. Not only do the females have difficulty finding food for their young, but a fire destroys the cover they need to ambush the few animals that remain - and the number of cubs gradually dwindles to just two.(n)

programme.title: Wild Burma: Nature's Lost Kingdom

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Examining the heartland of the country, home to ancient structures such as the Great Wall and modern buildings like Beijing's Olympic Stadium, as well as animals including the giant panda and golden snub-nosed monkey. However, the region holds even deeper cultural significance as the land of origin of China's most populous ethnic group the Han people - whose 5,000-year-old traditions are increasingly under threat.(n)

programme.desc: The annual migration of wildebeest, gazelles and zebras away from the Serengeti grasslands, and how their departure affects a pride of lions left behind, which struggles to survive without a ready source of prey. Not only do the females have difficulty finding food for their young, but a fire destroys the cover they need to ambush the few animals that remain - and the number of cubs gradually dwindles to just two.(n)

programme.title: Conquerors
programme.desc: Documentary examining the pine processionary caterpillar, which is threatening Europe's forests thanks to its ability to defoliate vast tracts of pines.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor travels to South Africa, where he finds himself in shark-infested waters while paddle skiing. He also catches an octopus and tries his hand at reef fishing in a bid to land a huge salmon.(n)

programme.title: Tarsier Tails
programme.desc: At Burnt Rock Tower, baby Ardhi is attacked by a gecko, and narrowly escapes with his life.(n)

programme.title: Tarsier Tails
programme.desc: Kadi and her baby Ardhi have escaped danger at Burnt Rock Tower, but being on the run means they have not eaten for a whole day.(n)

programme.title: Wild Burma: Nature's Lost Kingdom
programme.desc: Film-makers from the BBC's Natural History Unit and scientists from America's Smithsonian Institution venture into Burma's jungles to catalogue its species in the hope of getting protected status for the area. The team sets out to discover whether the mountains in the west are home to a population of Asian elephants that could prove critical to the survival of the species. Gordon Buchanan and Justine Evans search the valleys and ridges, while biologist Ross Piper follows up rumours of a second herd.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ones
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into the lives and behaviour of the planet's fastest creatures.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Wild Burma: Nature's Lost Kingdom
programme.desc: Film-makers Gordon Buchanan and Justine Evans head deep into the mountains of western Burma in search of the sun bear, the Asian golden cat and the clouded leopard. Meanwhile, zoologist Ross Piper and the science team carry on their mission to create a wildlife survey to present to the government of Burma, while undercover filming in a border town leads to a shocking discovery.(n)

programme.title: Six Feet Under the Savannah
programme.desc: Documentary studying the East African savannah and the habits of the naked mole-rat, which lives in the harsh conditions beneath the surface of the sand and dwells in queen-oriented communities similar to insect societies. The film uses sophisticated slow motion filming techniques and a replica of the animal's habitat in a vivarium to bring the unusual creatures' world to life.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor hunts for blue marlin in the North Atlantic and, in the Canary Islands, samples the dubious marine delicacy of escolar - consumption of which is banned in several countries. Finally he heads to Spain, where he grapples with the wels catfish, which can grow up to 10ft in length.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Great Events
programme.desc: David Attenborough describes the annual surge of more than 100 million sardines along South Africa's east coast as inshore waters cool with the arrival of winter. This marine spectacle provides a feast for competing predators including dolphins, whales, sharks and seabirds, but the sardine run has become less predictable in recent years - posing a threat to the creatures that depend on it to survive.(n)

programme.title: Wild Burma: Nature's Lost Kingdom

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Built to shelter ancient China from hostile barbarians to the north, the Great Wall also serves as a cultural curtain, beyond which can be found a variety of traditions. This programme goes outside the Wall to meet tribes of reindeer herders on the Siberian border, and explores deserts to the north where ruined cities were once bustling staging posts for camel trains on the legendary Silk Road.(n)

programme.title: Tarsier Tails
programme.desc: Jakub, the leader and father of the Burnt Rock Family, dies. Unaware, the tarsiers remain hidden in their backup tree - without protection.(n)

programme.title: Tarsier Tails
programme.desc: Burnt Rock youngster Elai finds his father Jakub's body while out hunting, and a flashback reveals how the elder tarsier met his fate.(n)

A brilliant young mathematician is recruited by his professor to join a crack team of students whose system of card-counting is enabling them to win millions from the casinos of Las Vegas. How long can their winning streak last, however, once a suspicious head of casino security makes it his mission to bring an end to their forbidden activities?(n)

programme.title: Double Jeopardy
programme.desc: Cuando Nick Parsons aparenta haber sido asesinado por su esposa Libby, ésta es juzgada y encerrada en prisión, pero ella sospecha que su marido sigue vivo. Cuando seis años más tarde, es puesta en libertad, es ayudada por su agente de la condicional Travi(n)

programme.title: Walk the Line
programme.desc: From his early years on an Arkansas cotton farm through to superstardom as a country music singer, this moving film charts the fascinating life of Johnny Cash. Biopic(n)

programme.title: You Don't Mess With the Zohan
programme.desc: Adam Sandler fans have plenty to laugh about in this fast-paced, surprisingly political comedy about an oversexed Israeli commando with unstoppable fighting skills and a secret dream: He yearns to move to New York City and become a hairdresser. After faking his own death, he makes that dream come true---sort of(n)

How long can their winning streak last, however, once a suspicious head of casino security makes it his mission to bring an end to their forbidden activities?(n)

programme.title: The Burbs
programme.desc: Three neighbours try to discover why a new family only comes out at night(n)

programme.title: Idiocracy
programme.desc: Plucked from the ranks of the US Army because he is the most unremarkable, average individual they have, Corporal Joe Bauers participates in a top-secret human hibernation experiment that is intended to put him to sleep for a year. He is joined by prostitute Rita, who believes that she will escape from pending criminal charges if she takes part. After a series of mishaps, including the arrest and incarceration of the officer in charge of the project, the unlucky pair are abandoned and forgotten, only to wake up 500 years later in a world where the rampant breeding of stupid people has created a universally dumb society ruled by half-wits. Thus Joe and Rita find themselves in a brave new world where they are the two most towering intellects on the planet in Mike Judge's sci-fi comedy(n)

programme.title: Donnie Brasco
programme.desc: Textured characterizations galvanize director Mike Newell's gritty goodfella odyssey. Gangster Lefty Ruggiero (Al Pacino) takes a streetwise punk (Johnny Depp) under his wing, unaware that his protégé is really an FBI agent out to bust the New York mob. Michael Madsen, Bruno Kirby, James Russo(n)

programme.title: Days of Thunder
programme.desc: Cole Trickle is an ambitious young NASCAR racer determined to prove himself. In order to realise his dream, Trickle teams up with Harry Hogge, a legend in the race car world who builds the hotshot driver a car worthy of his skills(n)

programme.title: PCU
programme.desc: Actor Hart Bochner turns director in the satirical Animal House update P.C.U.. Per the title, the film takes place on the campus of a University where, thanks to militant dean Jessica Walter, Political Correctness has reached ridiculous proportions. A group of dorm-room cutups, wallowing in their uncorrectness, declares war on the uptight student activists who call the shots. Saturday Night Live's David Spade is among the leading players; while he's funnier here than in his costarring stints in Chris Farley's films, he doesn't have much to work with. The subject matter covered in P.C.U. has already been tackled, with far funnier results, on Bill Maher's cable-TV weekly Politically Incorrect(n)

programme.title: The Diary of a Teenage Girl
programme.desc: In this poignant adaptation of the acclaimed graphic novel, a precocious teenage girl living in 1970s San Francisco tries to understand the connection between sex and love after she seduces her bohemian mother's boyfriend(n)

programme.title: The River Wild
programme.desc: A headstrong white-water rafting expert takes a holiday with her family, but their fun comes to an abrupt end when two killers show up. The fugitives' only escape route from the law is down a raging river, so they take her hostage as a guide. Meanwhile, the rest of her family tries to keep track of them from the riverbank in a desperate race to rescue her(n)

programme.title: Clerks
programme.desc: Critically acclaimed 'Generation X' comedy about a day in the life of a pair of shop workers. Shot in black-and-white, the movie stars Brian O'Halloran as Dante, the young assistant in a convenience store, and Jeff Anderson as Randal, an employee in the video rental shop next door(n)

programme.title: Days of Thunder
programme.desc: Cole Trickle is an ambitious young NASCAR racer determined to prove himself. In order to realise his dream, Trickle teams up with Harry Hogge, a legend in the race car world who builds the hotshot driver a car worthy of his skills(n)

programme.desc: In a genetically modified future, janitor Ethan Hawke is determined to beat the system and become an astronaut(n)

programme.desc: The walls of time and space break down in this rollicking sci-fi adventure, in which an ambitious teen discovers a pin that transports her to a futuristic world. She then teams up with a jaded genius, and they embark on a mission to save the Earth(n)

programme.desc: Ambitious Midwestern parents try to balance their burgeoning careers with the mayhem of raising 12 children(n)

programme.title: Pixels
programme.desc: When aliens mistake images of 1980s arcade games as a sign of aggression, they attack Earth with evil versions of Pac-Man, Donkey Kong and other video-game characters. In response, the U.S. president (Kevin James) asks his old gamer pals (Adam Sandler, Josh Gad, and Peter Dinklage) to battle the invaders(n)

programme.title: Little Miss Sunshine
programme.desc: Road comedy about parents taking their spunky 7-year-old daughter and dysfunctional family from New Mexico to California for a kiddie beauty pageant(n)

programme.title: Reservoir Dogs
programme.desc: The grim, violent tale of a heist gone wrong. Six criminals - all with pseudonyms, and strangers to one another - are hired for a diamond robbery, but they are ambushed by police and forced to shoot their way out. At their warehouse rendezvous, the survivors, realising they were set up, try to find the traitor in their midst as this controversial exploration of betrayal moves inexorably to its blood-soaked climax(n)

programme.title: I Know What You Did Last Summer
programme.desc: Four teenagers accidentally run over a stranger and hide the body rather than inform the authorities, only to find themselves stalked the following year by a shadowy figure who takes great delight in disposing of them in a variety of gruesome ways. Horror, starring Jennifer Love Hewitt, Sarah Michelle Gellar, Ryan Phillippe, Freddie Prinze Jr and Anne Heche(n)

programme.title: In Too Deep
programme.desc: An undercover cop becomes too close to an Ohio drug lord, ultimately endangering the police operation(n)

programme.title: New Jersey Drive
programme.desc: New Jersey Drive opens with Jason (Gabriel Casseus) heading off to juvenile detention then unfolds in flashback as, chronologically, the incidents leading to his arrest surface one by one. First the audience sees his violence and poverty-ridden project; next his go-nowhere delinquent friends are introduced, as is their hobby: joy riding. Soon some of the teens, including Jason, begin to convert their hobby into a part-time job as they steal cars and sell them to a sleazy chop-shop owner for pennies on the dollar. Eventually, luck runs out when they are caught in a police sting; one boy is shot to death by the crooked Officer Roscoe (Saul Stein), who then warns Jason not to tell a soul; however, they continue stealing cars. Meanwhile, Jason beats up a neighborhood acquaintance on the playground for a slight to his sister and finds himself the target of the boy's murder attempts. The action draws to a head as both Roscoe and the vengeful boy close in(n)

programme.title: Freaks of Nature
programme.desc: A town full of humans, zombies, and vampires living in coexistence are thrust into an all-out war when aliens invade. Now, three teens (Nicholas Braun, Josh Fadem, and Mackenzie Davis) must defeat the newest visitors to restore the peace their town previously held. Robbie Pickering directs this horror comedy(n)

programme.title: Redbelt
programme.desc: Writer-director David Mamet's riveting drama touches on the worlds of mixed martial arts, Hollywood and shady con men. Chiwetel Ejiofor gives a knock-out performance as a jujitsu instructor who gets conned into fighting in a money bout after getting backed into a financial corner. Mamet is a practitioner of jujitsu. Alice Braga, Tim Allen, Ricky Jay, Joe Mantegna. Mixed-martial-arts fighter Randy Couture costars(n)

programme.title: The A-Team
programme.desc: West-Coast Turnaround. Action drama series. The team come to the aid of a farmer and his daughter who face bankruptcy when a rival stops them from delivering their produce to market(n)

programme.title: Existenz
programme.desc: A video-game designer is trapped in one of her own creations in David Cronenberg's foray into the world of virtual reality(n)

programme.title: The Covenant
programme.desc: An ancient secret threatens to unleash the powers of darkness on a group of modern prep-school students when the sole survivor of a cursed bloodline returns to lay claim to the powers denied to him centuries ago in a supernatural teen thriller from director Renny Harlin and screenwriter J.S. Cardone. The story begins in 1692, when five families from the Ipswich Colony of Massachusetts formed a covenant of silence that would forever protect their remarkable powers. One family went too far, though, and as a result of their transgression they were forever banished from the land. Flash forward to the new millennium and the four Sons of Ipswich are now the student elite at the prestigious Spenser Academy. Bound by their sacred ancestry and sworn to silence, these four teens share a secret so remarkable that it has served to protect their families for hundreds of years. The past has a way of coming back when you least expect it though, and when the fifth Son of Ipswich returns seeking to harness the powers denied him in the past, the battle is on to ensure the safety of The Covenant and lay the one descendent who threatens to reveal their secret to rest once and for all(n)

programme.title: Machine Gun Preacher
programme.desc: Gerard Butler stars in Marc Forster's violent, fact-based drama about a substance-addicted criminal who finds God and relocates to Sudan to offer his own idiosyncratic brand of Christian charity. The film initially portrays Sam Childers as being a far from nice man: a misogynistic biker whose life is steeped in crime, narcotics and violence, and who quickly returns to armed robbery almost as soon as he's released from jail. But while he was inside, his wife Lynn found Jesus, and, after Sam gets stabbed, she urges him to join her at church. Sam subsequently has his own Damascene moment and starts life afresh, founding his own (legitimate) construction company. Before long he has also built his own church. But it's only after a trip to Sudan, where he witnesses the devastation wrought by the marauding Lord's Resistance Army, that he truly becomes driven. Relocating to the African country, he sets up a faith-based centre to care for victims of the LRA's violence and rape. And also takes up arms to literally fight the good fight... Also starring Michael Shannon(n)

programme.sub-title: Where in the World Is Carmine O'Brien?.
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a police chief, and Lisbon is in for a surprise when her bounty hunter brother Tommy and his daughter turn up unexpectedly. programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane suspects a blogger's fascination with serial killers may have led him to commit murder in an attempt to achieve a twisted kind of fame. Unfortunately the FBI takes over the case before he can gather enough evidence to make an arrest, prompting him to try another strategy. Aware that the suspect craves publicity, he arranges for him to appear on a TV talk show. Directed by and starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane is called to a nightclub car park where an undercover policewoman has been shot, and discovers she was trying to obtain incriminating evidence against a drug kingpin - whose henchmen later kidnap him. His only chance of escape lies in playing a psychological game with the dead woman's partner, who appears to have begun to identify with her underworld contacts so closely that she has changed sides and become a criminal.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A former American football star's assistant dies in a car bomb, which Jane believes was intended for the sportsman, so he sets up a ruse to make the killer believe the attack was successful and the athlete is dead. The team compiles a list of suspects and tries to draw out the criminal at a memorial service, but the investigators uncover a long list of enemies with different motives. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: A wealthy 80-year-old man who recently married a young stripper is found dead and, when his widow dies of an overdose, all eyes turn to the butler. Despite a lack of support from her colleagues, Brenda decides to investigate the victim's three grown-up children instead.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda struggles to gain control of an investigation into the murder of a businessman and is eventually partnered on the case by Fritz. However, she discovers the FBI has ulterior motives, putting their friendship under further strain. Kyra Sedgwick stars.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The team members are forced to reopen a botched murder investigation from three years previously as they attempt to get a pyromaniac serial killer safely behind bars. Meanwhile, Taylor continues to wage his political war on Brenda's rank. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick and Robert Gossett.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: A complaint is filed against Brenda, which threatens her career in the squad, but when Captain Pope offers to help, she is dubious about his intentions. Meanwhile, the detectives are kept busy trying to trace the killer of a Hollywood producer. Kyra Sedgwick stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team is called in to investigate when marine corporal Flegman is found shot to death, and a phone leads them to a hotel room where Gibbs awkwardly stumbles upon his ex-wife Diane Sterling and her FBI agent ex-husband TC Fornell. She had been attempting to call her boyfriend Eddie to break up with him, but somehow Flegman had taken possession of his phone. The team tracks down Eddie's car and discovers a clown nose along with traces of blood and he quickly becomes the prime suspect.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigate when a mysterious, fast-spreading illness strikes children from military families. While Gibbs investigates the cause, Abby and Jimmy partner with the Naval Medical Research Centre in the hope of delivering a cure before the holidays. Mark Harmon stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A petty officer is killed by a stolen surveillance drone and the team links it to elusive terrorist Benham Parsa. NCIS joins forces with the Department of Defence to track down the device before it is used for a large-scale attack, but Gibbs is less than pleased that he has to work with his ex-lover Hollis Mann. Meanwhile, McGee hopes he will be granted time off to attend a black-tie gala honouring his girlfriend Delilah. Guest starring Susanna Thompson (Arrow).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: In an effort to find the terrorist Parsa, Gibbs and the NCIS team track down one of his cohorts using evidence gleaned from the drone attack which has killed six people and wounded a further 22. Meanwhile, an emotionally shaken McGee struggles with the ramifications of the incident. Drama, starring Mark Harmon, Sean Murray, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter helps Joe to publish a book, but things get out of hand when he starts to take on the writing as well. Elsewhere, Brian begins an extreme exercise regime after experiencing a runner's high for the first time.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter learns about phone apps and his newly acquired enthusiasm soon sees his phone overloaded. He buys a new mobile with greater memory and gives his old one to Chris, which sets in motion a series of horrible events leading to his son being branded a sex offender and sent on a rehab course.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Hayley experiences the hardships of pregnancy when Roger agrees to `give birth' to Jeff to make him human again. Meanwhile, Snot is offended when Steve signs him up for a makeover.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: Stewie, Chris and Brian's Excellent Adventure.
programme.desc: Stewie and Brian use their time machine to help Chris pass his history test so he does not have to re-sit the whole year, but trouble ensues when the trio all get stuck in the past.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Part two of two. Brian moves into his cousin Jasper's Hollywood apartment and tries to start a career in screenwriting. Things are slow taking off, and he spends some time washing cars and working as a waiter to make ends meet. When his break finally comes, it is not quite what he had in mind.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter becomes the president of a cigarette company that uses toy products to promote smoking among children. Lois initially urges him to take a stand against the policy - but the perks of his new job soon persuade her to drop her opposition.(n)

programme.desc: Rick hacks the cable box so that TV from multiple realities can be accessed, while Jerry, Beth and Summer are focused on another of Rick's inventions.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: The Smiths are unaware Roger plans to become `king of spring break' by inviting students to party at their home. Meanwhile, Steve tries to lose his virginity and Stan is attracted to a vivacious new friend.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: On Roger's 1,600th birthday, Steve announces he is going through puberty. With Hayley's transition still fresh in the memory, Stan plots to avert any trouble caused by his son's raging hormones.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine encourages Stan to open up emotionally, but gets more than she bargained for when he reveals a dark secret concerning the fate of a neighbour's husband. As the revelations continue to emerge, Roger takes it upon himself to play psychiatrist to the pair.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan is asked to smoke out a former KGB agent and is shocked to discover the spy has not only moved in next door, but has also converted Steve into a communist. Meanwhile, Klaus is caught smuggling drugs on his way to France.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Part one of two. Brian is awarded a prestigious job as a sniffer dog for the Quahog police department, only to suffer the embarrassment of becoming addicted to cocaine and referred to a rehabilitation clinic.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger releases photographs of himself to the media, prompting the CIA to form an Alien Task Force to deal with the situation. Meanwhile, Francine gets to grips with being left-handed.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Thin Blue Line
programme.desc: College students cause chaos during their traditional rag-week fundraiser, stretching the local constabulary's patience to breaking point. Unfortunately DI Grim has other matters on his mind - like dealing with a real-life bank raid. Ben Elton's comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson and David Haig.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: Timothy falls for a narrowboat owner and resolves to leave home, but is surprised when Mother appears to be in favour. Ronnie Corbett stars.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel and Jean spend a nostalgic day in Buckinghamshire reliving their courtship days - but find things have changed in the intervening years.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor endures a sleepless night - and naturally ensures the eternally put-upon Margaret and their neighbours share in his suffering. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Things to Do When Your Wife Runs Off with a Turkish Waiter.
programme.desc: Barry and Glenda get a shock when a man they foolishly exchanged addresses with on holiday turns up on their doorstep. To make a strained situation worse, it appears their guest has an unusual hobby.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Beware of Laughing at Nora's Hats.
programme.desc: Alvin tries to persuade Nora Batty to go for a ride in his sidecar, but she's having none of it. When she relates the story of her long-standing feud with Audrey Craig - who had the audacity to laugh at her hat during a wedding many years ago - it becomes clear the broom-brandishing battleaxe is not one to be messed with.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Yours Truly - If You're Not Careful.
programme.desc: Billy and Alvin learn that Truly's ex-wife is trying to find him, and waste no time in gleefully tormenting their pal with the news of a strange woman's appearance in town. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates are shocked to discover there is a thief in their midst, so Fletcher decides to stage a mock trial to bring the culprit to justice with the help of Slade's resident legal consultant Judge Rawley. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Maurice Denham.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Nurse Gladys decides Arkwright needs a lesson in politeness, and convinces him a writer for the Good Shop Guide is doing the rounds. She then poses as the critic to see for herself the unusual sight of the miserly shopkeeper being nice to his customers. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Lynda Baron.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: In the first episode of the classic sitcom, beleaguered and badgered hotelier Basil Fawlty tries to attract a better class of clientele, but ends up being taken to the cleaners by the first seemingly upper-crust customer to check in. Starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales, Andrew Sachs and Connie Booth.(n)

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom tries to market his garden produce, but finds it more difficult than he imagined - especially with the added pressure of paying the household rates. Richard Briers and Felicity Kendal star.(n)

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom's philosophy of life gains him two eager disciples - but he is soon anxious to be rid of them. Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: The Fast Show
programme.desc: Rapid-fire comedy show, in which the Alcoholic Family has breakfast and Bob Fleming goes badger watching. Paul Whitehouse, Charlie Higson, Arabella Weir and Caroline Aherne star.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes becomes concerned when Dermot announces he wants to ask his childhood friend Buster, a known criminal, to be his best man. However, she is distracted when her neighbour Winnie's husband is rushed to hospital, leaving her son trying to raise funds for his wedding by getting embroiled in a money-making scheme.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Jon Richardson, Sara Pascoe and Nathan Caton.
programme.desc: Jon Richardson, team captain on 8 Out of 10 Cats, hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, west London, warming up the crowd before introducing routines by fellow comedians Sara Pascoe and Nathan Caton.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Jeremy joins a band, but insists he is not going to be their roadie. Mark tries to forget Sophie by stalking shop assistant April - which results in him pretending to be signed up to the same history course as her. Offbeat comedy, starring Robert Webb and David Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: Squalid students Vyvyan, Rick, Neil and Mike try to liven up a boring day with a trip to the pub, and have to contend with their landlord's insane nephew. Anarchic comedy, with special guests Madness starring alongside Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson.(n)

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: The king comes down with the black death, and summons the Witchsmeller to expose the evil sorcerers he holds responsible - with Edmund the prime suspect. Frank Finlay guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Jon Richardson, Sara Pascoe and Nathan Caton.
programme.desc: Jon Richardson, team captain on 8 Out of 10 Cats, hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, west London, warming up the crowd before introducing routines by fellow comedians Sara Pascoe and Nathan Caton.(n)

programme.title: Big School
programme.desc: Miss Postern asks the other teachers to look after troubled pupil Josh, whose mother has gone off with a Masai tribesman. Before long, the boy is given a part in Greybridge's presentation of Romeo and Juliet in an attempt to take his mind off his problems. However, Mr Church has lost his job as theatre reviewer for the school magazine - and when Miss Postern takes his place, with Josh's father for company, the gormless science teacher is more than a little jealous. Classroom comedy, starring David Walliams, Catherine Tate and Philip Glenister.(n)

programme.title: Little Britain
programme.desc: Dennis Waterman is offered the chance to star in a new series of Minder. Vicky Pollard finds out she's pregnant, Emily buys a bunch of flowers on the promenade and Matthew Waterhouse presents interesting ideas for breakfast. With Matt Lucas and David Walliams.(n)

programme.title: The Thin Blue Line
programme.desc: Grim tracks down criminal carol singers, and Fowler falls victim to the ruthless Gasforth Amateur Dramatics Society. Goody, meanwhile, discovers giving presents to colleagues is not guaranteed to create goodwill. Festive instalment of the comedy from 1995, starring Rowan Atkinson and David Haig.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: Timothy is evicted from the family home for destroying his parents' car, but he finds that is only the beginning of his troubles.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean pays an unexpected visit during Lionel's lecture tour - only to be surprised herself. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: The Meldrew household echoes to the sound of laughter, as Margaret joins the local amateur dramatic society and Victor begins penning a sitcom script. However, his mother-in-law's bath-time accident and a run-in with British Telecom soon leave the curmudgeonly codger in no mood for jokes. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg, Truly, Alvin and Billy encounter a stranger who is determined to travel by canal to Ilkley in an inflatable swan. However, when punctures disrupt the man's dream, Entwistle is on hand to ensure the voyage goes to plan. Tommy Cannon and Bobby Ball guest star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg climbs a tree to prove a point, but finds getting down is not as easy. Meanwhile, the police investigate the case of a runaway cooker. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Has Anyone Seen a Peruvian Wart?.
programme.desc: Roy Barraclough guest stars as Crowcroft, a well-known Lothario with a preference for gullible women. When he samples Nora Batty's baking, he decides to make her his next target. Long-running comedy, with Kathy Staff, Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates decide on a wager as the parole board gathers, with Blanco odds-on favourite for release. However, the old lag turns down his freedom and leaves Fletcher in danger of losing a small fortune. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: The pals look forward to celebrating Christmas, but an unexpected guest disrupts their plans as Richie suffers delusions of grandeur and the whole spirit of the festive season is jeopardised. Anarchic comedy, starring Adrian Edmondson and Rik Mayall.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Eight more contenders enter the kitchen, where Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace challenge them to make a dish of their own invention using a selection of seven ingredients - including pork sausage, squash, Gorgonzola, walnuts and almonds. They each have just one hour to hold their nerve and demonstrate their creativity to the judges.(n)

programme.title: Destination Flavour Japan
programme.desc: Adam Liaw takes viewers on a culinary journey to Japan, beginning by discovering the delights of sea urchin, pond smelt and boutique cheesecake on the country's northern-most island Hokkaido.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining three hopefuls compete in the 2011 final, which sees them cooking for a street party attended by judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, as well as friends, family and former Bake Off contestants. Their offerings include mille-feuille, mini Victoria sponges, and miniature strawberry and rhubarb cheesecakes. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The fourth quarter-final sees the four heat winners take on the fiendishly difficult palate test, recreating John Torode's poached and fried pepper chicken, with herbed gnocchi, and mushroom and tarragon sauce, having only had a couple of minutes to taste the food and write down what they think the ingredients are. Can they identify the three types of mushroom in the recipe? They then cook a showstopping dish for the judges and food critic Jay Rayner, before finding out who has made it through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: Sweet Baby James
programme.desc: Chef James Martin visits his old catering college in Yorkshire, and recreates a selection of the classic puddings he learnt to make there. He challenges friend and fellow pupil Andrew Pern to a cooking competition, and later travels to the World Chocolate Masters to see some of the country's leading chocolatiers at work.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers forage for food, exploring Britain's fields and hedgerows in search of free ingredients that will form the basis of spectacular dishes.(n)

programme.title: Ottolenghi's Mediterranean Feast
programme.desc: Chef Yotam Ottolenghi travels to the Greek island of Crete, which has a rich and complex culinary history with Turkey and north Africa as its neighbours. He travels to the capital Heraklion to make a variation of the Cretan dish meze dakos, consisting of tomatoes, crumbled feta, olives and oregano. In the fishing port of Agios Nikolaos he prepares octopus marinated in wine with baby squid stuffed with tomatoes and okra. Plus, on a trip inland, he uses feta for a cheesecake, and prepares a feast of spit-roasted pork souvlaki served with his twist on tzatziki.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Australia
programme.desc: Part two of two. The MasterChef judge continues his culinary adventure in Tasmania, visiting a unique brewery and cattle farm, before feasting on fish and chips and a seafood salad.(n)

programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four of the eight chefs from the previous heat return to face a skills test in which they must each debone a saddle of lamb and then roll and tie it ready for roasting. Michel Roux Jr then challenges them to recreate his recipe for mackerel tartlet with chive beurre blanc, before the contenders prepare their own choice of classic dish to be judged by Michel and Monica Galetti, who pick three to advance to the quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Another chance to see the 2012 contest, as presenters Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins invite 12 enthusiastic bakers to take part in a contest to determine which of them is Britain's best amateur, facing challenges devised by judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood. To begin with, they tackle an upside down cake, before following Paul's recipe for rum babas, a hybrid of cake and enriched dough that baffles some of the competitors. Finally, they are challenged to produce a show-stopping cake that reveals a hidden design when sliced into. Who will be first to leave?.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: John Torode and Gregg Wallace present the penultimate heat. The six hopefuls begin by dishing up their calling card, a single plate of food showcasing their talent in the kitchen, followed by the invention test, in which the ingredients include rhubarb, lime, pomegranate and popping candy, or pollock, sausages, Parmesan and quail's eggs. After two cooks are sent home, things get serious, with the rest preparing a two-course dinner for 2007 MasterChef winner Steven Wallis, as well as Sara Danesin and Alex Rushmer, finalists from 2011 and 2010 respectively. It's then down to the judges to decide which two will advance to Friday's quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers create classic puddings and explore the history and traditions behind Britain's favourite desserts. They also take part in the world black-pudding throwing competition in Lancashire.(n)

programme.title: Ottolenghi's Mediterranean Feast
programme.desc: Chef Yotam Ottolenghi explores the island of Sardinia, beginning in the fishing port of Bosa where he prepares one of the Mediterranean's greatest meals - freshly caught lobster roasted on an open fire. He then travels inland to share a meal of spit-roasted lamb accompanied with a salad of figs and radicchio with three generations of shepherds. Finally, while on a mountain top at dawn, he learns the secret of producing silky soft cheese for a dessert of ricotta fritters drizzled with golden honey and orange zest.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Australia
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part episode filmed in Queensland, the MasterChef judge prepares lunch for lifeguards by the Great Barrier Reef, and goes spear-fishing for crabs.(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: A mother and her daughter retreat to what they believe is a secure sanctuary during a brutal home invasion. Newly divorced Meg Altman (Jodie Foster) and her young daughter Sarah (Kristen Stewart) move into a New York brownstone equipped with a panic room; a hidden chamber built as a sanctuary in the event of unwanted "visitors," unaware of how soon they will need it. When their home is the target of a seamless late-night break-in, Meg and Sarah take a stand from the sanctuary of the panic room, playing a deadly game of cat-and-mouse with three intruders: Burnham (Forest Whitaker), Raoul (Dwight Yoakam) and Junior (Jared Leto), during a brutal home invasion(n)

programme.title: Next Day Air
programme.desc: An overnight shipment of drugs winds up being sent to the wrong recipient, prompting a frantic race to recover the package before the contents are discovered in this fast-paced crime comedy starring Donald Faison, Mos Def, and Mike Epps. When Brody (Epps) and Guch (Wood Harris) received package containing 10 kilos of grade-A cocaine, they assumed their financial woes were a thing of the past. The package was intended for their Brody and Guch's next-door neighbors, but the whacked-out courier (Donald Faison) delivered it to the wrong address. Recognizing the possibility for profit, the scheming duo plans to sell the cocaine to Brody's drug-dealing cousin (Omari Hardwick). Meanwhile Jesus (Cisco Reyes) and his girlfriend Chita (Yasmin Deliz), the intended recipients of the cocaine, set out to procure the package before notorious drug lord Bodego Diablo (Emilio Rivera) realizes it's gone missing. But Bodega is no slouch; he already knows the shipment was botched, and he's determined to get his drugs back no matter what the cost. Later, as Brody and Guch prepare to seal the deal that will set them up for life, the guns are drawn and the chaos begins(n)

programme.title: Risky Business
programme.desc: Tom Cruise stars as college-bound teenager who turns his parents home into a bordello to repay a debt while his parents are away. Rebecca de Mornay co-stars as the liberated call girl Lana. One of the key films of its generation which turned Tom Cruise into a box-office star(n)

programme.desc: A look at the U.S. armed forces' ban on gays and lesbians includes remarks from activists, politicians, and active and former service members; and a timeline of the contentious process leading up to the repeal of Don't Ask, Don't Tell, which takes effect on Sept. 20, 2011, and allows homosexuals to serve openly for the first time. Directed by Fenton Bailey and Randy Barbato(n)

programme.desc: A Southern matron forges a bond with her black chauffeur in the racially-divided 1960s South. Only when he is retired and she is confined to a home for the elderly do the two fully realise that they've been friends and kindred spirits all along(n)

programme.desc: Ultracool thriller crammed with guns and girls, with Samuel L Jackson as cop John Shaft going outside the law to hunt down white collar murderer Christian Bale(n)

programme.desc: Sinclair Broadcast Group. The Sinclair Broadcast Group and its ownership of local U.S. television stations; and Donald Trump's tweets about Mika Brzezinski are discussed(n)

programme.desc: Superman and Batman clash in this superhero movie(n)

programme.sub-title: Last Line of Defense & El Rostro
programme.desc: Last Line of Defense & El Rostro. A report on overworked and underpaid public defenders; a look at what indigenous tribes in the Peruvian Amazon are doing to protect their land from exploitation(n)

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: Years after the events of The Bourne Ultimatum, former CIA assassin Jason Bourne (Matt Damon) resurfaces just as his former employers are implementing a new program aimed at hunting him down. Now fully recovered from his amnesia, Bourne teams up with Nicky Parsons (Julia Stiles) to uncover the truth behind his father's death, while simultaneously exacting revenge and evading the government forces hot on his trail. Paul Greengrass returns to helm this sequel, which co-stars Tommy Lee Jones, Alicia Vikander, Riz Ahmed, and Vincent Cassel(n)

programme.title: Boiler Room
programme.desc: A college dropout gets a job as a broker for a suburban investment firm, which puts him on the fast track to success, but the job might not be as legitimate as it sounds(n)

programme.title: The Legend of Tarzan
programme.desc: Years after leaving the jungle and settling down with his wife Jane in London, Tarzan returns to the Congo to act as a trade representative for England(n)
