programme.title: The Abyss
programme.desc: (1989) After Aliens, James Cameron took to the ocean's depths for this sci-fi thriller. Ed Harris and Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio star as Bud and Lindsey Brigman, a husband-and-wife team running the rescue rig that's trying to get to a nuclear submarine that's gone down on the lip of one of the world's deepest sea trenches. But when psychotic Navy SEAL commander Lt Hiram Coffey (Michael Biehn) launches a nuclear warhead into the trench, they discover they are not alone in the depths... M,R,S(n)

programme.title: Like Sunday, Like Rain
programme.desc: A troubled musician becomes an au pair for a lonely 12-year-old cello prodigy, setting the stage for a friendship that leads to profound healing for both of them(n)

programme.title: Edge of Winter
programme.desc: A divorced man tries to reconnect with his two sons during a hunting trip in the wilderness, but the brothers realize that they might not be able to trust their father when a fierce snowstorm strands all of them in a deserted cabin(n)

programme.title: Darkness
programme.desc: A young family move to an outwardly quaint country home. Though the initial housewarming party is widely celebrated by neighbours, their houseguests become steadily fewer as a series of creepy happenings indicate that the house is home to more than their family(n)

programme.title: Chasing Amy
programme.desc: Ben Affleck and Jason are starting to make it as a comic strip creators but their friendship is threatened when Affleck falls head-over-heels for Joey Lauren Adams. Who is gay. Kevin Smith offers an engaging, amusing love story that carries an underlying seriousness about the pains of love(n)

programme.title: Mallrats
programme.desc: Comedy about a pair of hip teenagers trying to get through life. TS and Brodie retreat to the safety of the local shopping mall after disagreements with their girlfriends, Brandi and Rene(n)

programme.title: Moulin Rouge
programme.desc: An aspiring writer named Christian leaves behind his bourgeois father during the French belle époque of the late 1890s to seek his fortunes in the bohemian underworld of Montmartre, Paris. There Christian meets and falls into a doomed romance with the courtesan Satine, who becomes the star of the play he is writing(n)

programme.title: Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day
programme.desc: A romantic comedy about a prim, middle-aged British governess who finds herself caught in a love triangle when she goes to work for a dizzy American actress in 1939 London(n)

programme.title: The Remains of the Day
programme.desc: Anthony Hopkins stars in James IVory's subtle film adaptation of Kazuo Ishiguro's novel as a staunch butler of a post-World War I home whose loyalties are tested when a strong-minded housekeeper falls in love with him. Twenty years after working together at Darlington Hall, butler James Stevens receives a letter from Miss Kenton who was the Hall's housekeeper before the Second World War. As they reminisce about their time at Darlington Hall working together for the naive Lord Darlington, it's revealed that Miss Kenton had been in love with James, although his feelings for her were somewhat ambiguous. When Lord Darlington's ties with the Nazi cause are made public, James's dedication to his duty is challenged once more(n)

programme.title: Stage Beauty
programme.desc: The true story of two performers whose careers were changed forever by a shift in gender roles on the British stage comes to the screen in this adaptation of the play +Compleat Female Stage Beauty by Jeffrey Hatcher. In London, in the latter half of the 17th century, Ned Kynaston (Billy Crudup) is a noted star of the legitimate theater with an unusual specialty -- at a time when it was considered unseemly for women to work as thespians, Kynaston specialized in female roles, and was described by one writer as the most beautiful woman on the London stage. With the help of his faithful dresser, Maria Hughes (Claire Danes), Kynaston can turn himself into a striking actress in front of the footlights, and is starring opposite Thomas Betterton (Tom Wilkinson) in a production of Shakespeare's +Othello when, while still in costume after a performance, he is propositioned by theatrical impresario Sir Charles Sedley (Richard Griffiths). The sexually open-minded Sedley isn't discouraged to learn Kynaston is a man, but he is bitterly angered by the actor's flip rejection of his advances. Sedley takes revenge against Kynaston by hiring a gang of criminals to beat him up. With Betterton's production of +Othello closed while the leading "lady" recuperates, Hughes sees an opportunity and stages an underground version of the play, casting herself as Desdemona. While she lacks Kynaston's dramatic skills, the daring of her appearance on-stage creates a sensation, and King Charles II (Rupert Everett), a noted theater buff, is so taken with Hughes that he declares women should play women from now on. But as Hughes' star rises, Kynaston's quickly falls, and he becomes a bitter, forgotten man. When the novelty of Hughes' gender wears off and her failings as an thespian become obvious, she turns to her former friend Kynaston, hoping he can teach her to be as good an actress as he was. Stage Beauty's supporting cast includes Ben Chaplin, Edward Fox, and Hugh Bonneville(n)

programme.title: Moulin Rouge
programme.desc: An aspiring writer named Christian leaves behind his bourgeois father during the French belle époque of the late 1890s to seek his fortunes in the bohemian underworld of Montmartre, Paris. There Christian meets and falls into a doomed romance with the courtesan Satine, who becomes the star of the play he is writing(n)

programme.title: Dan in Real Life
programme.desc: A widowed advice columnist who is struggling to raise three daughters falls in love with a French beauty---unaware she is his brother's girlfriend. Steve Carell ("The Office") and Juliette Binoche star in this charming romantic comedy. Dane Cook, Alison Pill, Brittany Robertson, Marlene Lawston. Directed by Peter Hedges(n)

programme.title: Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day
programme.desc: A romantic comedy about a prim, middle-aged British governess who finds herself caught in a love triangle when she goes to work for a dizzy American actress in 1939 London(n)

programme.title: Jimmy's Hall
programme.desc: Political activist Jimmy Gralton returns to his hometown in Ireland in 1932 following a 10-year exile in America. He decides to reopen a community hall with the help of the locals, but faces opposition from both the government and a crotchety priest, who suspect the hall is a hotbed for loose morals and communist activity(n)

programme.title: Mallrats
programme.desc: Comedy about a pair of hip teenagers trying to get through life. TS and Brodie retreat to the safety of the local shopping mall after disagreements with their girlfriends, Brandi and Rene(n)

programme.title: To Rome With Love
programme.desc: Locals and tourists in Rome find their lives intersecting. An architect tries to recapture his youth; an ordinary guy unexpectedly becomes famous; a couple is torn apart by new love interests; and an opera director urges a mortician to sing on stage(n)

programme.title: Moulin Rouge
programme.desc: An aspiring writer named Christian leaves behind his bourgeois father during the French belle époque of the late 1890s to seek his fortunes in the bohemian underworld of Montmartre, Paris. There Christian meets and falls into a doomed romance with the courtesan Satine, who becomes the star of the play he is writing(n)

programme.title: Testament of Youth
programme.desc: An adventurous young British woman wins a scholarship to Oxford, where she falls in love with a fellow student. Later, their relationship is tested when he joins the military following the onset of World War I(n)

programme.title: Rust and Bone
programme.desc: A single father (Matthias Schoenaerts) meets a woman who trains killer whales (Marion Cotillard). But tragedy awaits..(n)

programme.title: Kill Your Darlings
programme.desc: Three ambitious writers befriend each other at university and get involved in a murder case before becoming central figures in the Beat Generation(n)

programme.title: Imagining Argentina
programme.desc: Accomplished British screenwriter Christopher Hampton directs the political drama Imagining Argentina, based on the novel by Lawrence Thornton. Set during the unsettling disappearances in Buenos Aires during the dictatorship of the 1970s, the film involves theater director Carlos Rueda (Antonio Banderas) and his wife Cecilia (Emma Thompson). Shortly after Cecilia writes an editorial commentary questioning the mysterious abductions, she is herself abducted and taken into police custody. Soon Carlos develops the supernatural ability to see into the future and he imagines his wife meeting an awful fate during an escape attempt. To make matters worse, their teenage daughter Teresa (Leticia Dolera) is also kidnapped. Imagining Argentina was nominated for the Golden Lion at the 2003 Venice Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Labyrinth of Lies
programme.desc: In this fascinating drama, a German prosecutor becomes interested in the case of a schoolteacher who once worked at Auschwitz. In time, the prosecutor attempts to build as many cases as possible against the 8000 people who worked at the death camp(n)

programme.title: Blue Jasmine
programme.desc: A New York socialite is forced to move in with her sister after her marriage falls apart. Comedy drama(n)

programme.title: Passengers
programme.desc: Young therapist Claire (Anne Hathaway) is assigned to counsel the survivors of a plane crash and is intrigued by Eric, the most secretive of them. In spite of that, her professional relationship with him blossoms into a romance as the survivors begin to disappear mysteriously, one by one. Claire suspects that Eric may hold the answers and becomes determined to uncover the truth, no matter the consequences(n)

programme.title: Trainspotting
programme.desc: The FilmFour funded Trainspotting is acknowledged to be one of the most original films to come out of Britain in the last decade. The multi-award-winning film based on Irvine Welsh's novel, stars Ewan McGregor, Ewen Bremner, Jonny Lee Miller, Robert Carlyle, Kelly Macdonald and Kevin McKidd in a story of drugs, survival, scams, friendship and tragedy(n)

programme.title: Renaissance
programme.desc: Christian Volckman's groundbreaking rotoscoped monochrome animation is set in dystopian Paris, 2054. The biggest company - bigger even than the city's government - is cosmetics company Avalon, run by Paul Dellenbach. When one of their valuable scientists is kidnapped, rogue cop Barthelemy Karas takes on the case and teams up with Bislane Tasuiev but each new lead takes them into deadlier peril..(n)

programme.title: Trust the Man
programme.desc: Two couples demonstrate that breaking up can be just as hard as staying together in this romantic comedy drama. Rebecca (Julianne Moore) and Tom (David Duchovny) are a seemingly happy married couple living in New York City -- she's a successful actress, while he stays home with the kids. However, beneath the surface, things are not going well. Rebecca is no longer amused with her husband's appetite for porn and constant sexual demands, while he's seriously considering having an affair. Rebecca's brother Tobey, (Billy Crudup), is in a more openly dysfunctional relationship; he's been dating Elaine (Maggie Gyllenhaal) for seven years but has no interest in marriage, while she's desperate to settle down and start a family. Tobey and Elaine decide to call it quits, as Tobey hooks up with an old friend from college (Eva Mendes) who is looking to cheat on her husband, and Elaine starts dating a handsome musician (James LeGros) who may be in need of a green card. Meanwhile, Rebecca and Tom go into couples therapy, which creates as many problems as it solves. Trust the Man also features Ellen Barkin, Garry Shandling, and Bob Balaban(n)

programme.title: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
programme.desc: Terry Gilliam's film stars Johnny Depp as Raoul Duke (a thinly disguised Thompson) and Benicio Del Toro as his companion Dr. Gonzo en route to Las Vegas to report on a convention of district attorneys, fuelled only by a collection of almost every illegal drug going and enough booze to float a battleship(n)

programme.title: Roll Bounce
programme.desc: Xavier Smith , known to his friends as X, is a teenager growing up on the South Side of Chicago in the late '70s. X and his buddies are the hotshot skaters at the Palisades Gardens, a neighbourhood roller rink where local kids roll to the latest disco sounds, but X loses his status as king of the hill when the Palisades closes down(n)

programme.title: Ricki and the Flash
programme.desc: Ricki is an aging rock-n'roll-loving woman who abandoned her family in order to chase her tattered dream of becoming a famous rock star. Now, she is given one last chance to set things right when her ex-husband, Pete, asks her to visit her estranged daughter, Julie, in Chicago(n)

programme.title: Nick & Norah's Infinite Playlist
programme.desc: High school student Nick O'Leary, member of the Queercore band The Jerk Offs, meets college-bound Norah Silverberg when she asks him to be her boyfriend for five minutes(n)

programme.title: The Kids Are All Right
programme.desc: The biological father of a lesbian couple's two teen children enters their lives after the son expresses a desire to find him, and the sperm donor's easygoing demeanor has a profound effect on the family(n)

programme.desc: Xavier Smith , known to his friends as X, is a teenager growing up on the South Side of Chicago in the late '70s. X and his buddies are the hotshot skaters at the Palisades Gardens, a neighbourhood roller rink where local kids roll to the latest disco sounds, but X loses his status as king of the hill when the Palisades closes down(n)

programme.title: Prime
programme.desc: A recent divorcée begins a relationship with her therapist-friend's younger son in this by-the-numbers romantic comedy(n)

programme.title: One More Time
programme.desc: Reeling from personal and professional disappointments, a musician moves into the Hamptons home of her father, a Sinatra-esque crooner still hoping to make a career comeback. In time, father and daughter bond while seeking success in the music industry(n)

programme.title: The Kids Are All Right
programme.desc: The biological father of a lesbian couple's two teen children enters their lives after the son expresses a desire to find him, and the sperm donor's easygoing demeanor has a profound effect on the family(n)

programme.title: Thank You for Smoking
programme.desc: The directorial debut from Jason Reitman, the media satire Thank You for Smoking stars Aaron Eckhart as Nick, a man who has turned spinning news and information into a successful career for the tobacco lobby. He plots strategies with his colleagues (Maria Bello and David Koechner) on how to make other dangerous products more appealing to the American public. Nick ends up going to Hollywood with his young son (Cameron Bright) in order to get a movie producer to include characters smoking in his newest film. Nick is kidnapped by a vigilante group concerned about the harmful nature of his product. The cast includes William H. Macy as a Senator who runs on a strong anti-tobacco position, Rob Lowe as the Hollywood bigwig, and Robert Duvall as the king of the tobacco industry. The film is an adaptation of the novel of the same name by Christopher Buckley(n)

programme.title: Hot Shots!
programme.desc: Parody of "Top Gun" in which a talented but unstable fighter pilot must overcome the ghosts of his father and save a mission sabotaged by greedy weapons manufacturers(n)

programme.title: Prime
programme.desc: A recent divorcée begins a relationship with her therapist-friend's younger son in this by-the-numbers romantic comedy(n)

programme.title: A Smile like Yours
programme.desc: Romantic comedy in which a wealthy young couple decide to have a baby, only to discover that the process is not as straightforward as they imagined(n)

programme.title: Hedwig and the Angry Inch
programme.desc: His/ her tale told in flashback via his/ her songs, Hedwig was born in the GDR and wanted to be a woman from an early age. Promise of marriage to a US army serviceman, providing he had a sex change operation, promised a way out, but one botched operation later, leaving the "angry inch", he/ she's dumped alone in America. Hooking up with Tommy Gnosis, the two form a band but then Gnosis quits, stealing Hedwig's material and going on to stadium-filling fame while a bitter Hedwig is reduced to supper club gigs, shadowing Tommy's tour with a set of songs that tell the story of his/ her life(n)

programme.title: Bandidas
programme.desc: Salma Hayek and Penélope Cruz star in this ripping Comedy-Western about two Mexican beauties who become outlaws to avenge the deaths of their fathers, who were murdered by a ruthless robber baron (Dwight Yoakam). Sam Shepard and Steve Zahn costar as members of their gang. Directed by Joachim Roenning and Espen Sandberg. Filmmaker Luc Besson co-wrote the script with Robert Mark Kamen. Denis Arndt, Audra Blaser, Karl Braun, Ismael Carlo, Carlos Cervantes(n)

programme.title: Two Girls and a Guy
programme.desc: In this darkly comic tale of love and infidelity, Carla (Heather Graham) and Lou (Natasha Gregson Wagner) are both waiting outside an brownstone in Soho and happen to strike up a conversation. It seems both of them are waiting to meet their respective boyfriends, and as they discuss the bright, funny, romantic and monogamous men they've been lucky enough to become involved with, they make a surprising discovery -- they're both waiting for the same man, Blake (Robert Downey Jr.), an actor, musician and compulsive womanizer. As they compare notes on the man they've been unknowingly sharing and what they should do about the situation, Blake arrives and quickly starts trying to talk his way out of the disastrous situation. Writer and director James Toback claims he was inspired to write this project for Robert Downey Jr. after seeing a news report showing him in jail after violating parole regarding an arrest for drugs; Two Girls and a Guy was written in four days and shot in eleven days on a single set, and features excellent performances from Downey, Graham, and Wagner(n)

programme.title: Down to You
programme.desc: Kris Isacsson's debut film stars Freddie Prinze Jr and Julia Stiles as a young couple who fall in love and start a passionate affair but after a summer abroad, she feels stifled and what was once an easy-going romance now becomes an affair that must be worked for(n)

programme.title: Grandma's Boy
programme.desc: From executive producer Adam Sandler comes this outrageously funny farce about the antics of a 35-year-old video-game tester (Allen Covert) who is forced to move in with his grandmother and her oversexed and overmedicated roommates. Linda Cardellini, Peter Dante, Shirley Jones, Shirley Knight. Directed by Nicholaus Goossen(n)

programme.title: Bandidas

Sam Shepard and Steve Zahn costar as members of their gang. Directed by Joachim Roenning and Espen Sandberg. Filmmaker Luc Besson co-wrote the script with Robert Mark Kamen. Denis Arndt, Audra Blaser, Karl Braun, Ismael Carlo, Carlos Cervantes(n)

programme.title: One More Time
programme.desc: Reeling from personal and professional disappointments, a musician moves into the Hamptons home of her father, a Sinatra-esque crooner still hoping to make a career comeback. In time, father and daughter bond while seeking success in the music industry(n)

programme.title: Thank You for Smoking
programme.desc: The directorial debut from Jason Reitman, the media satire Thank You for Smoking stars Aaron Eckhart as Nick, a man who has turned spinning news and information into a successful career for the tobacco lobby. He plots strategies with his colleagues (Maria Bello and David Koechner) on how to make other dangerous products more appealing to the American public. Nick ends up going to Hollywood with his young son (Cameron Bright) in order to get a movie producer to include characters smoking in his newest film. Nick is kidnapped by a vigilante group concerned about the harmful nature of his product. The cast includes William H. Macy as a Senator who runs on a strong anti-tobacco position, Rob Lowe as the Hollywood bigwig, and Robert Duvall as the king of the tobacco industry. The film is an adaptation of the novel of the same name by Christopher Buckley(n)

programme.desc: Robert Townsend directed this biopic chronicling the colorful life of rock legend Little Richard (Leon), who scored with hits like "Tutti Frutti" and "Long Tall Sally."(n)

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop II
programme.desc: Eddie Murphy returns as Axel Foley, the loud-mouthed cop from Detroit who's back to shake up Beverly Hills after chief Andrew Bogomil is nearly killed. Teaming up again with Det Billy Rosewood, who's developed an unhealthy liking for firepower under Foley's influence, and Det Sgt John Taggart, they set out to crack the 'Alphabet Crimes' - robberies from heavily guarded premises. Chief suspect is Maxwell Dent, who's protected by heavy Charlie 'Chips' Cain and assassin Karla Fry. And it's not long before the quiet of Beverly Hills is shattered by car chases and shoot-outs in Tony Scott's comedy cop-thriller(n)

programme.title: The Last Supper
programme.desc: Deftly blending pitch-black humour with grippingly intimate storytelling, The Last Supper is a dark comedy of good food, fine wine and potent points of view. Directed by Academy Award nominated Stacy Title, The Last Supper features Cameron Diaz, Annabeth Gish and Ron Eldard as graduate students who want to save the world from the hypothetical horrors of tomorrow. The group holds a lively series of weekly dinner parties, with carefully chosen, politically controversial dinner guests played by Jason Alexander (Seinfeld), Bill Paxton (Twister), Mark Harmon (Wyatt Earp) and Ron PerIman (Beauty and The Beast). Regardless of the conversation, the repast is always delightful, delectable and deadly-with tomatoes picked fresh from the shockingly fertile backyard. This wickedly delicious satire puts a sharp and stylish spin on what's right and left - and right and wrong - in contemporary American politics(n)

programme.title: Cloak and Dagger
programme.desc: Juvenile actor Henry Thomas, late of E.T., is the star of Cloak and Dagger. Given to telling whoppers, Thomas finds himself in a boy-who-cried-wolf dilemma when he overhears two spies plotting to smuggle valuable info out of the US. When he can't get his own father Dabney Coleman to believe him, Thomas turns disconsolately to a computer game called "Cloak and Dagger" and begins to fantasize, imagining that he is in cahoots with secret agent Jack Flack, also played by Coleman. Finally coming to grips with the fact that the mythical Jack Flack cannot help him this time, Thomas takes on the spies with the help of his schoolmates, who are also "Cloak and Dagger" addicts. Cloak and Dagger is a heavily disguised remake of 1949's The Window; both are based on the Cornell Woolrich story The Boy Cried Murder(n)

programme.title: Ponyo
programme.desc: A charming family fantasy-adventure from Hayao Miyazaki - master of Japanese animation and director of Spirited Away and Princess Mononoke - that reworks Hans Christian Andersen's The Little Mermaid. When five-year-old Sosuke is playing down by the water of his fishing town, the last thing he expects to see is a goldfish with girl's face. Her real name is Brunhilde and she's the daughter of Fujomoto, a powerful human wizard who has renounced life on land for one in the ocean's depths. Boy and fish-girl are instantly smitten with each other, and he gives her a new name, Ponyo. She returns to her father to say that she no longer wants to live in the sea and would prefer to be human. Angered at the prospect of losing her, as well as at mankind's ill-treatment of the oceans, Fujimoto unleashes a catastrophe that threatens Ponyo's true love and his terrestrial community..(n)

programme.title: Alpha and Omega
programme.desc: Kate and Humphrey are two mismatched wolves who embark on a cross-country quest to get back home and restore peace in their pack after being relocated thousands of miles away by well-meaning park rangers. Humphrey likes to frolic with friends and play video games with squirrels while disciplined Kate likes to call the shots and hunt caribou. Normally, an omega wolf like Humphrey would never stand a chance with an alpha wolf like Kate, but now they must work together to get back to their natural habitat. Even though a growing mutual appreciation of their talents and then a deeper love threatens to disastrously complicate everything if they make it home..(n)

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: One More Pallbearer. Hoping to get even with several old enemies, millionaire Paul Radin (Joseph Wiseman) stages an elaborate hoax in the bomb shelter of his own office building. Inviting three people -- the teacher who flunked him (Katherine Squire), the military officer who courtmartialed him (Trevor Bardette), the minister who condemned him from the pulpit (Gage Clarke) -- to the shelter, Radin calmly informs them that he has "inside information" that a nuclear war is about to commence, and backs up this assertion with a carefully orchestrated series of radio bulletins and air-raid sirens. Sharkishly adopting a "no hard feelings" pose, Radin offers to allow his visitors to remain in his shelter during the bombing -- but only if they will drop to their knees and "beg his pardon." The ending of the episode is one of Twilight Zone's trickiest...but also one of the most logical. Written by Rod Serling, "One More Pallbearer" was originally telecast January 12, 1962(n)

programme.title: Source Code
programme.desc: Jake Gyllenhaal headlines this sci-fi time-travel thriller directed by Moon's Duncan Jones from a script by Ben Ripley and Billy Ray. A bomb explodes on a Chicago train, derailing the locomotive and killing hundreds. In an attempt to identify the bomber and prevent another, larger attack on downtown Chicago, Captain Colter Stevens (Gyllenhaal) agrees to take part in a clandestine government experiment dubbed "Source Code," which allows him to enter the body of a male passenger during the eight minutes before the man is killed. But during his first trip back, Capt. Stevens fails to gather enough clues to prevent the second attack. With time quickly running out, he repeats the mission ad nauseam in a desperate race to head off one of the most deadly terrorist attacks ever to take place on American soil(n)

programme.title: XXX
programme.desc: The director (Rob Cohen) and star (Vin Diesel) of the previous summer's hit The Fast and the Furious (2001) are reunited for this spy thriller billed as a next-generation James Bond adventure. Diesel stars as Xander Cage, a nihilist extreme sports enthusiast nicknamed "Triple X" because of a large tattoo covering his back and neck. Cage's illegal stunts and poor attitude (he's given to spouting dialogue such as, "Have you ever been punched in the face for talking too much?") land him in jail, where he's recruited/blackmailed into government service by the National Security Agency's Augustus Gibbons, who likes Cage for his skills and expendability. The new secret agent is assigned to infiltrate a Russian crime ring called Anarchy 99, whose access to biochemical weaponry is making the United States extremely nervous. With the help of some high-tech gadgets from weapons master Toby Lee Shavers (Michael Roof), Cage is able to make his way into Anarchy 99, where he targets the group's leader Yorgi (Marton Csokas) and falls for the organization's second-in-command, Yelena (Asia Argento). XXX (2002) is the first in a hoped-for franchise of sequels for the film's producer, Revolution Studios(n)

programme.title: Drive Angry
programme.desc: Milton (Nicolas Cage) breaks out of hell to save his granddaughter from being ritually sacrificed, and receives help from a waitress while being chased by an evil cult leader and one of Satan's minions in this adrenaline-charged supernatural thriller(n)

programme.title: Salt
programme.desc: Loyal CIA operative Evelyn Salt fights to disprove accusations that she's a Russian spy, only to find that the harder she works to prove her innocence, the more suspicious her superiors become of her true motives. With CIA agent Peabody hot on her trail, the stakes get higher with each second she eludes capture(n)

programme.title: The Adjustment Bureau
programme.desc: Rising politician David Norris (Matt Damon) realizes that a shadowy cabal known as the Adjustment Bureau has been altering the fabric of time and space in order to keep him separated from a beautiful ballerina, and decides to fight back(n)

programme.title: Source Code
programme.desc: Jake Gyllenhaal headlines this sci-fi time-travel thriller directed by Moon's Duncan Jones from a script by Ben Ripley and Billy Ray. A bomb explodes on a Chicago train, derailing the locomotive and killing hundreds. In an attempt to identify the bomber and prevent another, larger attack on downtown Chicago, Captain Colter Stevens (Gyllenhaal) agrees to take part in a clandestine government experiment dubbed "Source Code," which allows him to enter the body of a male passenger during the eight minutes before the man is killed. But during his first trip back, Capt. Stevens fails to gather enough clues to prevent the second attack. programme.title: Dark Matter
programme.desc: Give It Up, Princess. The crew must rescue kidnapped royalty to retrieve a file which could halt intergalactic war(n)

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: One More Pallbearer. Hoping to get even with several old enemies, millionaire Paul Radin (Joseph Wiseman) stages an elaborate hoax in the bomb shelter of his own office building. Inviting three people -- the teacher who flunked him (Katherine Squire), the military officer who courtmartialed him (Trevor Bardette), the minister who condemned him from the pulpit (Gage Clarke) -- to the shelter, Radin calmly informs them that he has "inside information" that a nuclear war is about to commence, and backs up this assertion with a carefully orchestrated series of radio bulletins and air-raid sirens. Sharkishly adopting a "no hard feelings" pose, Radin offers to allow his visitors to remain in his shelter during the bombing -- but only if they will drop to their knees and "beg his pardon." The ending of the episode is one of Twilight Zone's trickiest...but also one of the most logical. Written by Rod Serling, "One More Pallbearer" was originally telecast January 12, 1962(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: A Little Murder. Grissom suspects murder, not suicide, when the body of a dwarf is found hanging from a rope high above a stage in a casino hotel where a convention of little people is being held. Across town, Catherine is attacked at a crime scene where a man was murdered during what appears to have been a home robbery(n)

Petersen) pieces together the evidence when an abandoned aluminum toolbox yields a human skeleton -- infested with imported fire ants(n)

programme.title: Married...With Children
programme.desc: How to Marry a Moron. Although dimwitted Lonnie (Charles Esten) has only recently held the Bundy family hostage, Kelly Bundy (Christina Applegate) has fallen madly in love with him--and in fact wants to become his bride. Al (Ed O'Neill) is dead set against the union, rightly summing up Lonnie as a faithless fool, but he changes his mind when he discover that the boy's father (Gordon Jump) is a millionaire. Originally telecast back-to-back with the previous episode "The Desperate Half-Hour", this final-first run Married. . .With Children installment has all the earmarks of a pilot for a spinoff starring Christina Applegate and Charles Esten--until Al throws a monkey wrench in the works in the last few seconds!(n)

Also, Ross (David Schwimmer) finally decides to dump his bald-domed girlfriend, Bonnie (Christine Taylor), while Rachel (Jennifer Aniston) writes Ross an impassioned letter. programme.title: Seinfeld
programme.desc: The Opposite. Although it was not the last episode shot for the show's fifth season -- that would be "The Hamptons," which aired second to last -- it makes sense that "The Opposite" aired last, as several turns of events set the stage for the sixth season. It all starts with George deciding to do the opposite of everything he would normally do. Once he puts the plan into action, the perennial loser suddenly sees things going well for himself. He gets a girlfriend, a job with the Yankees, and finally moves out of his parents house. Meanwhile, Jerry realizes that his luck is "even Steven," Kramer appears on Live! With Regis and Kathy Lee to promote his coffee-table book about coffee tables, and Elaine suddenly can't win, leading her to believe that she has switched places with George. Originally airing May 19, 1994, the fifth-season closer guest starred 3rd Rock From the Sun's French Stewart and featured the first appearance of the faceless George Steinbrenner, voiced by co-creator Larry David(n)

Meanwhile, Rachel's (Jennifer Aniston) climb to the top is sidetracked by her boss, Joanna (Alison La Placa), and Monica (Courteney Cox) is given the opportunity to write a food-critic column -- which results in a conflict with two different people in her life. programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: The Courtship of Wyatt's Father. The duplicitous Gideon (Gildart Jackson) conspires with the Darklighters to get rid of Leo (Brian Krause). As a result, Leo and Piper (Holly Marie Combs) are banished to the Ghostly plane, which may well prevent the birth of their future son, Chris (Drew Fuller) -- who in turn realizes he must be conceived immediately or his Whitelighter "self" will permanently vanish. Meanwhile, Phoebe (Alyssa Milano) and Paige (Rose McGowan) are convinced that Piper is dead, which definitely casts a pall over Wyatt's first birthday party(n)

Meanwhile, Sam is stuck in the kid's body and deals with intrusive parents and high school(n)

programme.desc: The Doom in the Gloom. An investigation of the death of a US marine reveals the deceased's obsession with the apocalypse and a link to a group of doomsday preppers. Meanwhile, Sweets finds an apartment he loves, but Brennan and Booth doubt that he'll move out of their house(n)
